text:
I really owe this place 20 more great reviews because we go there all the time and I've never been disappointed.  The fish is always fresh and Johnny will create a roll for you if you can't find one on the menu you like.
The staff is like family and very friendly.
This is still my favorite place!!

This is the best sushi place in Las Vegas. We always sit at the bar and Eric, James and ken take great care of us. If you are nice enough James might even give you some of his fresh wasabi. 
We always get a sashimi plate, a fish or two on special and a roll. The fish is very fresh and is always cut great. The jonny roll, designed by the owner, is really good. 
The atmosphere is great at the sushi bar. We always end up talking to the people siting by us and have a great time. If you like sushi, you need to come to momos!
This placebos going down hill. Not sure if a change of ownership but was pretty much told I need to give a 5 star rating to redeem my Yelp free dessert.  Not going back for sure.

I was extremely hungry, but not to the point I would eat something that isn't fresh. The rice was hard and  color of the albacore was questionable. I ate two pieces and I think I'm nauseous?!! Even the tempura appetizers were gooey and doughy. Money wasted

Have been several times and every time it delivers the goods.  My wife and I love every visit as we have a long list of favorites we now order.  Highly recommend to any sushi lovers out there. Great food at a great price

Very disappointed. The place is very dark and dirty. A huge cockroach was crawling on our table. The fish wasn't fresh. Seafood salad was way too salty. I hope I won't get sick after visiting this place! The service is pretty slow, even though it wasn't busy. Our tea was never refilled.

I've been dining at Momo Sushi for over 4 years and I will continue to come back.

I find the Momo Hamachi and the Irish Roll to be absolutely delicious! 

The wait staff is always pleasant and the chefs are comical and friendly.

The decor needs to be updated and the excess flyers hanging all over the place needs to be removed, its an eye sore.

i have been going to momo sushi for years!! the staff is always friendly, the owner julie is great, and i have literally not found anything on the menu i didnt like. sooooo good. it's mouthwatering delicious!!:-)

So when I walked into this place they were jammed packed with two servers on the floor. Andrew realized we did not even have our drinks and we had been there for a good 10 minutes. He promptly came to our table and offered a booth. We took that offer. Not only was the food on point but the service was even better ! Thanks Andrew I'm so full and satisfied.. the desert was the topper. See y'all soon!

I really like Momo. I usually have to cross town to get good sushi but I'm so glad I found a place close to home that is really good. There is a plentiful menu and the chefs make everything look really beautiful. The prices are reasonable, especially for sushi and there's always sports on the TVs. I'm becoming a regular here.

Awesome! I live in southern California and eat sushi at the the most 5 star places. This is right up there without the price tag and double the portions. I am a sashimi junkie. I'm pretty sure they are flying the stuff in from LA on a share with another restaurant . in other words it was alive yesterday for certain. They even have hotegai and mirugui. The rolls are ridiculously amazing and huge. I was in awe...I am coming back in august for my birthday dinner. This place puts any so cal sushi roll place out in the cold. It rules. PS service was awesome and unlike most so cal spots, people who work here are japanese !!!! Thank you thank you! I would eat here everyday if I could. Go and go here!! Yes yes yea!
Sashimi and sushi aren't fresh and they're heavily salted (assuming that's how they're preserving their fish).
Great atmosphere- very welcoming. Sit at the bar and watch them create delectable little bites. Try the yellow tail sashimi. Very lite, fresh and clean and the sauce is hot and sweet.

Went there not expecting much as it was out first try at sushi in Henderson and we got a pleasant surprise.  The staff is very friendly and the food is good.  I am a HUGE fan of sushi and this place seems fresh to me, not to mention they have a huge list of Specialty rolls that i suggest trying.  Or you can sit at the sushi bar and tell them exactly what you want and they'll whip it up.  We've been back 3 times and it's been good every time, except one time they forgot a roll (a group of 6, so maybe smaller groups are better).  Very good, I always get a Tall Sapporo or Kirin Ichiban with my meal too, great beer.  

Enjoy
Went for New Years Eve for the first time and it was delicious. Sushi was fresh and a good price. The decor could use a little freshening up, the booth I sat in was ripped .

Ive been going here since high school (2006) and quality of fish and service has not gone down. Yelp didnt exist back then but i would have rated them the same as i am doing so now. They have incredible rolls and food quality is second to none! Highly recommended for sushi !
Best sushi in Vegas!! Highly recommend the Irish roll and the somethings wrong 69!! Jenny is the best!!!!
Our favorite spot to eat! The lunch specials are awesome and the Momo box is my favorite. Servers are super nice too! We've been coming here for years now.
Are you kidding...best sushi hands down. My family and I have been going here for 12 years! Both my boys request this restaurant for "birthday dinner" and any chance they can!!!!

Just moved to Vegas and stumbled upon this place.  The udan noodle soup was full of goodies including egg, tofu, vegies and two tempura shrimp.  The sushi was fresh and everything had a great taste to it.  Would recommend this restaurant for sure.

First time here and was well pleased with the service. Andrew and Megan were quick to answer questions I had on some of the sushi rolls. Kiss of Fire was delicious. The plum ice cream was very tasty as well. I would come again.

Haven't been in a couple of years and it's still on the top of the list!  Went last night and had the most amazing new roll. . Something wrong 69. Of course right after a screaming oo. Left the last roll up to the sushi chef and he was right on point. Just as Delicious as I always remembered!

Our first time trying this new restaurant in BC -- wonderful!  Everything was fresh and flavorful.  We had the sushi dinner with a sampler of sashimi and the ultimate tuna roll, shrimp tempura udon, and salmon teriyaki.  Excellent!  The staff was friendly and helpful.  We sat outside and enjoyed the evening on the quiet plaza.  We'll definitely be back!
Impressive ambience and food! The only thing bothered me was the club music they were playing but the food and service was excellent! Check it out.

I really enjoyed this restaurant.  There are some unique menu items that I have not seen at other establishments.  In fact, when I was there we ordered a roll that used noodles instead of rice, and it was yummy.  There are whiteboards behind the bar with tons of daily specials.  It is conveniently located near many stores, so you can work up an appetite shopping, then stop in for a bite to eat.
not to bad, the food and sushi were alright. im not much for japanese but i did like this place.

Momo, was recommended to us for lunch by a local girl, working at our doctors office. 
My wife and I had an excellent meal there.
Crispy Eel Roll, Lobster Roll, and numerous Nigiri, including Cajun Tuna Belly. All the fish was great! James our Sushi Master, made up a couple special plates, great guy, great staff!
It was post lunch rush and so it was a nice atmosphere.

I went here for Dinner, yesterday. I ordered simple things. Salmon and Albacore Nigiri and a Eel Roll.
This should have been an easy one.
The waiters were pleasant. The only redeeming quality
Well, I first got the Salmon. It was dry and slightly Chewy. Then came the Albacore. Or should I say, partially seared, Albacore. For some reasonm they decide to sear it, without making it clear, on the menu. Otherwise I wouldn't have ordered it. The thing I love about Albacore, is the melt in your mouth texture. This was Crap! I couldn't eat my order,
This presentation of Sushi destroyed my desire for Sushi, for a couple months.
I will not return here, as there are better places, not far.
They should be ashamed.

Ever time I go to Vegas..I just got to go to Momo Sushi restaurant. From the moment you walk in..till you leave..you are treated with the utmost hospitality. The food there is awesome..don't pass this place up..you'll definitely miss out a special place.

Grateful to get a REAL sushi restaurant/chef in Boulder City!  Delicious...if you're a local or passing through Boulder you will not be disappointed.  I've had sushi  on the coast in many locations...this is prepared very well.

This is my favorite Japanese restaurant in the Las Vegas/Henderson area. The California roll is delicious. I don't eat sashimi, so I can't be a judge of that, but the other food I have had there is consistently delicious. I love the Momo Box and have it almost every time I come here.

Momo sushi...thank you for introducing me to the bento boxes.  Can't get a better deal than that!

I love this place.  I lived way across town.  But when I do get the craving, no doubt I pay my homage to you.
I love this place so much. I come at least once a month for my sushi fix. Everything is always so delicious!
Momo's is amazing! Great food and atmosphere! I've been a loyal diner since they opened. The soft shell crab wrapped in hamachi is glorious!

The sushi was great, and I really appreciated my waitress letting me sit for over an hour as I worked on a project. They were very kind and explained the different dishes to me. I was even able to try one or 2 since I had never ventured away from my usual dishes.

One of my favorite spots for sushi. Always fresh and always a great experience. The only problem is, I live too far away to be here everyday! I love the MoMo Hamachi. It is a must for me. It melts in your mouth. The service is good and the food is great. What else could you want?
We love Momo Sushi!  Food is fantastic and the server, Taylor, is fantastic!  So glad we have a really good sushi restaurant in Boulder City!!
This place is a hidden treasure !! All the staff are friendly & very accommodating.  Have back been several times & never disappointed highly recommend !!

Momo sushi provided me with the best sushi i've ever tasted..The rolls were delicious, fresh,bright,flavorful and imaginative...OMG..The sashimi were so tender it melted in my mouth..It was excellent!!!I've never been disappointed by a visit here..I was also pleased with the service...We highly recommended this place!!!!
Good food, beer, saki and service on all accounts. Accommodating a solid penchant for sushi in Calgary isn't easy however they come as close to mark as I've seen. Huzzah.

We've been to Momoyama's multiple times, but really only because it's close to home. We're all sushi/Japanese food fanatics, and to us they are pretty mediocre. The nigiri style sushi is just ok...not amazingly fresh by any means. They do have a few cool rolls to try, and that really is their only strength. The miso soup is always weak, as is the service. I can't really recommend this place, as Vegas is chalk full of better places to get your raw fish on. However, if you find yourself in the area and hungry for sushi, go ahead and stop here. It'll be "ok".

Tried this restaurant last night.  I liked the atmosphere and friendly service.  Unfortunately, our server didn't know the ingredients in most of the Specialty Rolls and the menu does not provide a list of the ingredients or photos.  This made ordering dinner difficult.  Our server did ask and come back with an answer but I couldn't really understand her so in the end I ordered my usual - Rainbow Roll, Tempura Roll and an appetizer Tempura (2 Shrimp, and 3 vegetables).  Tempura was fluffy and crispy.  The rolls were a good size although it was not cut evenly and the rice was a little too wet - you can tell when the rolls are stuck to the plate.  It was not outstanding by any means.  Presentation of the food was nice and I felt the prices were very reasonable.  I would not return to this estabilishment.  When I want sushi - it needs to be exceptional because it's usually not cheap.

Fresh, Fresh, Fresh. Some of the best tasting Sushi I've ever had. I've been going there for years. 

Johnny, the owner, is an excellent host. Share some Sake with the chef, they love to have fun too ! I can't complain about the 2-4-1 house Sake they are offering now.

Friday nights are packed. The Tuna Karai is excellent.

We are very biased because my family absolutely loves sushi just about any kind of sushi we love it all and this place fit the bill staff was very kind and friendly and made some special little things for the kids.

Great sushi. Great value. Really quick service.
Wish the menu had more description though

This is EASILY my favorite sushi place in town. I've been to most but if you're looking for amazing food, great people and a really fun time then this is the place for you. 

The weekend specials (fresh LIVE shrimp, blue fin toro, etc..) are definitely what set this place apart from the rest.
"My favorite place for fresh sushi! Dine-in or order for pick up, the staff is always nice."

This place is a favorite place for sushi, it is excellent quality especially for the price, which is reasonable. I come here often with my brother for sushi. The staff is friendly and the food is good.
Service is really bad here, they barely speak English, will walk by your table and ignore you. The sushi is good, not the best not the worst. I will go somewhere else next time.
Some of the best sushi I have ever had.  I was in Boulder City on business and did not expect to find such a mouth watering sushi restaurant.  Highly recommend.

Consistently awsome sushi. always fresh great sushi chefs owner is very kind and personable. Try the live shell fish on weekends especially live scallop and abalone.  incredibly fresh salmon and tuna. spicy tuna hand rolls are very generous. they need some work on the salmon skin hand roll. no gobo root really come on.

First time here and I'll definitely be back for news. Excellent lunch specials!! $9 for two sushi rolls, salad, rice, and dumplings. Instead of two sushi rolls, my kiddo had chicken teriyaki and chicken katsu. She loved both (but didn't care of the katsu sauce). They have a good assortment of rolls, the restaurant was clean, and the staff friendly. Well done Momo!

This sushi restaurant is worth the drive to Boulder city from Henderson. It's a hidden gem. I wish I had taken a picture of the sushi but we ate it all so fast! They even gave us fresh wasabi which I've never been offered before it was so delicious. We will be visiting again soon.

Great lunch with quality sushi and rolls. For lunch i  recommend the sushi lunch12.99 you get 6 pieces of sushi and a too along with appetizers. 
Dinner grab the list. It's all good great service and people.

We had an exceptional lunch. Wonderful food. The shrimp tempura was the best I have ever had. My husband had the Combo A spicy tuna roll. Everything was fresh and beautifully presented. The hostess (owner?) was cheerful and responsive. The atmosphere was comfortable. We will definitely return.

Went for lunch midweek.  Arrived about an hour before the lunch special ended and were seated immediately.   Lunch special is $8.95 for two items (add a buck for beef or salmon).  Served Bento style with miso soup as a starter.  Portion sizes were pleasantly larger than I expected.  They also have a sushi lunch for $12.95 consisting of one roll and 6 pcs of nigiri sushi.  Decor and staff are a plus as well.  Overall a great lunch spot if you're in the area.  They also have an extensive selection on their SPECIAL rolls.  Worth checking out for you sushi fans.
Www.momosushilasvegas.com for full menu.
My wife says it's absolutely delicious. Unfortunately I can't have seafood so I'm unable to join her. Very nice Ambience though and pleasant staff

I'm not a big fan of sushi.  I like it, but it's not something i get excited about when the family decides they want sushi.

This place is the exception.  I've had their various rolls and they were all typical for sushi, until, i had their Sex on the Beach roll!  Just, WOW!  

Now whenever my family wants sushi, I get excited to come here, and get my Sex on the Beach roll!  Their crab rangoon is very good as well.

They get quite busy and sometimes it takes a bit before our server delivers our bill, or takes are next order, but I look around the restaurant and see every single seat filled, and I understand so I exercise some patience.

Went on Sunday late afternoon. I would give it 4 stars if they would have turned the music off. I have no idea why any restaurant even bothers with music. It's simply irritating and detracts from an atmosphere of relaxation. I do not go to restaurants to be irritated by someone else's crappy taste in music coming out of tinny speakers.

The place was crowded. The tables are small and cramped. Very little space between tables too. Cramped enough that it was hard to find a place for our table of four to put stuff. The customers were well behaved at least. 

The service was only adequate. There were too many customers for the waitresses to have to juggle, but they were pleasant and did a decent job. The menu is very extensive so at least everyone (including those that don't care for sushi) can find something they may like. The green salad with ginger dressing was the best thing I had. Generally there was nothing wrong with the food, but my impression is that the needle was pointing a little to the bland side. I think the prices are about where they normally would be for a Japanese restaurant, but I've had better values at other sushi restaurants. Generally speaking I was happy to have experienced dinner there with my spouse and friends. I recommend you give it a try at least. I think you will find it .... OK.

Great food and service! They were open on this 4th of July day and we were happily surprised and hungry for sushi. We were seated quickly and our food brought to us within 10min. The wasabi was fresh along with the ginger.  We had green mussels, one of my favorites and it didn't dissappoint.  Rolls with fresh fish and great sauces. Pricing was about average.  Will definitely recommend and be back for more!!

I've been staying at the HGI in Henderson for 15 years and always going to Green Valley Ranch when I don't walk across the street to Sierra Gold. Looking for healthy and good, I searched for Sushi and found Momo. It may be in suburban Henderson but this sushi would play in Malibu without difficulty. Quality fish and I got introduced to lemon flavored Saki - Yuzu Aladin.  The selection of rolls is almost overwhelming, but great. I vouch for the Jennifer 2 and the Candy Canne.

Been going here for years, food and location is always good :) Fish is fresh and great serving size. Serving staff is also very friendly. Nice ambiance, perfect for date nights. Just the right amount of crowd.
My go-to sushi spot for dinner.  Love the tomato roll and rock-n-roll roll. Great tako (octopus) too!!

Everyone here is very nice. Sit at the bar and enjoy sushi that is unbeatable in Vegas. For the price, you won't find better quality fish. I bring coworkers from all over the country to this location. Haven't found anything better in my year here and it's close to what I've had in Vista, CA.

Variety of rolls is killer! White horse was delicious and citrusy. I think another rolls was called "when shrimp meets crab" which was amazing!!! Chef said it was the most popular. The only downside is that this place doesn't have an all you can eat option so the total bill was a bit more expensive. However, I would definitely come back if I wanted just a couple of rolls and not want to stuff myself. I came on a weekday night so it wasn't crowded and service was good.
By far the best sushi in town. James is an absolute master! Sit at the bar if you can. Absolutely in love with this place.
Love it. Food is amazing here. Great service, the people that work here is very friendly. Overall is a great place to eat and some delicious sushi.

The food here is so amazing!  The have quality ingredients. They have many dishes that you cannot find at an AYCE.  To top it all off, the customer service is nothing short of EXCELLENT!  Oh and the 2 for 1 sake?  DONE.

Best sushi in Vegas! Never had a bad experience, and the service is always top notch. My favorite rolls are the Irish Roll, Galleria, Mexico City, Lovely TSC and Kiss of Fire. Really though, every roll here is big, delicious and flavorful. The best!

I really love Momo Sushi.  I've been about 5 or 6 times.  The menu is simple, but the fish is usually very fresh, and prepared well.

This is nothing fancy, but really great quality sushi.  Will definitely keep coming back.

DELICIOUS!!! 
A bit pricey 
3 stars because the waitress was so unprofessional and rude. She didn't even say anything to us just grabbed the menus and sent us to a table.

For a local sushi spot-- this place is great! 

The fancy rolls are good, but usually when a place Is all about it's Americanized rolls it's usually because they are hiding the lack I flavor from their fish.

However, simple rolls and Sashimi are amazing too!  
 
My love and I split the sushi boat for two once and that was a gem! 

And ASAHI ZERO!!! If you don't drink but want sushi and a beer-- get this non alcoholic treasure! 

We keep trying to find it at a store but can only seem to find how to order from Japan! I appreciate them stocking it up!

Went to this place trusting Yelp to guide me right.  Overall feeling was "meh".  It just seemed there was no love in the food.  Tempura was just sufficient.  Nothing really stuck out as amazing.  I have absolutely no idea why it gets so many good reviews on the site.
I've only been here a couple times. The food is good and it's a nice quiet place to relax and enjoy. Staff is friendly and pretty quick with whatever you need.
Always enjoy the sushi and food here!  Great sushi chefs- make my special Spicy Shrimp Tempura Roll.
Sushi was very freshly made and tasted great. The waitress was nice and prompt. Wide selection of rolls to choose from. Will definitely go there again.
They sushi chefs are so friendly and their sushi is amazing I tired their Irish roll, and thought it was amazing

Ok, first of, this is a Japanese restaurant owned by Koreans, so you can start imagine the authentic quality of the "sushi" there.  Friends and I got there hoping that this newly opened restaurant could add a golden star of the day, but oh boy was I wrong... The waitor was so rude and the food was awful comparing with some of the good authentic sushi restaurants in town. This is definitely a no-go, go waste your money somewhere else.
My husband and I love sushi. The sushi is so good and fresh. I love the screaming orgasm. The servers are always friendly and the chefs are super funny!
Fantastic place and they definitely cater to there customer. Plus the price is great for high quality Japanese food. When I'm in the area I eat there.

It's fantastic!  Definitely a 5 Star sushi restaurant!

It's the best sushi in Henderson, NV.
Great food!  We ordered delivery via Door Dash and everything was great, order was accurate, delivery was fast, food was excellent.

They have original rolls, paired with amazing sauces.  I have never tasted so many great flavors in a sushi roll.  I have spend more $ on sushi and this was far better and you can chill at the sushi bar and watch football, love it!!!!

I moved here from Richmond, BC a year ago,(best sushi outside Japan) and I gotta tell ya this place is pretty good for Calgary.  It's not cheap, but I find it comparable in the city, good service and decent size sashimi pieces.

My friend and I went there today and I liked that it wasn't too loud or quiet. However after placing my order I noticed a cockroach crawling by my foot and not just a regular roach a big ass one! So we left. I'm sure the food is good but we were totally grossed out by the roach.
This is the only sushi restaurant I go to. My boyfriend loves the lunch special. They have delicious special rolls. I highly recommend stopping in there if you are in the area.

The food is good.  The food comes quickly, but otherwise the service is miserable.  The waitresses are slow, the refills have to be requested, and if you ask for no ice they forget on subsequent refills.  The worst part is the price; it is way overpriced... possibly the most expensive sushi in Vegas.  There are many better places that give you more bank for your buck.  Overall, an average place at best, but extremely overpriced.  Based on pricing, I would not return.

Arguably our favorite sushi spot out of anywhere we've been in any state.  Great vibe for either an evening out with the young kids, a quick lunch break, or a date night.  The food is tasty, the service is quick, noninvasive, no mistakes.
Walked by randomly and decided to check it out.  Wow what a find!!!  Food was great and prices aren't out to gouge you.   Def recommended
Great food as always . Bento dinner  is huge so make sure you are hungry or share it . Tempura dinner size is also big . Good atmosphere

The sushi here is excellent. The fish is very fresh; certainly one of the best sushi places in Las Vegas. I'm very glad they opened up in Boulder City. We'll keep coming back. Jen the waitress is excellent as well!
We just had lunch there. It was delicious as always. Its our go to place for sushi. Delicious food at a reasonable price and the service was great.

Went for lunch.  My second time there.  Waited 25 minutes for one roll.  Waitress said there was a miscommunication between her & the chef.  Asked to have some food boxed up.  Waitress took the plate & never came back with the box of left overs.  She said she threw it away.  Manager said the best they could do is $2.00 off the bill.  Oh, and I overheard the next booth complaining & wanting to see the manager.
Never again Momo!!!!!!

I have been going to Momo's ever since they have been opened and that has been well over 7 yrs ago. I have recently moved to Seattle, WA and have not found my new sushi place and having Momo withdrawals. 

I just wanted to say that they have amazing food and provide a friendly Atmosphere. I don't think anybody could be disappointed.  I would highly recommend the spicy baby Tako it is delicious and you wont find it anywhere else. 

The customer service is great. The owner and the staff know my family by our names which is awesome. The best seats are obviously at the sushi bar.   I can't wait to come back to Henderson its the first place I will visit.
I love this place! I go here all the time they just make good sushi. But beware a friend of mine got food poison once. I don't remember what he ordered but I would kinda look out.

Customer service is TERRIBLE!!! MANAGER IS VERY MEAN.
My boyfriend had ordered me a yum yum roll over the phone today and when i went to pick it up, I didnt check to make sure the order was correct (my mistake) but i assumed they had gotten in right since i was right next to him when he ordered it over the phone. When i got back to work, i realized my order was completely wrong. They gave me a salmon roll. My boyfriend called back and they told him it was a 1.50 dollar difference, but this time wouldn't let him pay over the phone (when they had JUST taken his card info over the phone on the first order) I told him it was fine and that i would just pay the difference when i got in, wasn't a big deal at all, just  weird. So when i got in, i gave them my card to pay the difference which wasn't even 2 dollars, and she told me the minimum for card transactions was 10 dollars. I had explained to her that they had messed up on my first order --which was only 6 dollars, not 10, and that i was just coming in to get the correct one and i didn't have any cash, thinking she would just let me do it on my card since they already messed up my first order. She started arguing with me and telling me i must purchase something for 10 dollars, which i wasn't going to do. Then she said she had a new waitress and that was why it happened. I said "so because your waitress messed up, im being punished'? she then asked me if i had the original messed up order, i told her no, i wasn't asked to bring it in. she said "well isn't it common sense?" HAAAA. I was very nice until this moment. Isn't it common sense to get my FIRST order right??? and then be polite when i come in, out of my way, for the SECOND time to get my order??? Lady was seriously out of line. I walked out and will NEVER be back to this restaurant again.

I've been here countless of times and have never left unsatisfied. The food here is great ( I recommend the Irish roll ). Service is great and the employees are always keeping a smooth vibe. Love this place.

Likely our new go-to place. We were regulars at another place and often were treated like royalty so we kept going. On a whim we tried Momo takeout before a drive-in movie. Our first comment was, "if takeout is this good... we need to dine-in."

So, we did. And it was excellent. Fun, cheesy, welcoming and the fish was fresh while the rolls actually took us by surprise along with the check which was half of what we were used to. We're quickly going to be regulars here.
Excellent sushi spot.  A hidden gem in Boulder City.  Stopped in on my way back from Hoover Dam!

Let's have some MO... Momo Sushi. An appropriate name for this place, Momo (more more) Sushi. What an awesome sushi place for lunch or dinner on this side of Henderson. 

The location is kind of odd as you don't really see it from Stephanie. The whole strip mall is not even facing the main road, it's awkwardly sideways. Just pull into the driveway past Marie Calendars and it will be on your left side.

So yes, the food here is awesome especially the Agadashi tofu. I've had this dish numerous times and I really do appreciate the presentation at Momo. The tofu is cut up in nice bite size pieces and sitting inside a bowl of broth. At other places the tofu is cut larger. When it's served larger so many awkward things can happen. 1) you cut it with your chopsticks and the crispy glaze breaks off. 2) you bite into it and you look like a Neanderthal with food dropping out of your mouth. 3) other embarrassing moments that should be left alone. The pieces at Momo were perfect!!

The rolls were so good. If you like tuna try the ultimate tuna roll. Spicy tuna with tuna on top, sitting in a spicy garlic type sauce/ oil. So good and the sauce keeps it moist! 

So yes, whenever I get my nails done at Euphora I'm high tailing to Momo for lunch... For MOre sushi and Agadashi tofu.

Oh don't forget to check in on Yelp! We received free green tea ice cream! YAY!

Our first date night after the birth of our baby boy and Momo Sushi was the perfect pick! We ordered the love boat and it was wonderful! The perfect mix of all the standards: sushi, teriyaki and tempura. The service was fast and friendly. The ambiance is simple. We will be back... Again and again!

Ever since my first visit here, I can honestly say this is the only sushi place I'll ever go to again. Period. The majority of the time, it's hardly busy, and if it is, service is still fantastic. The staff are very courteous and productive, and the waitresses are always on top of drink refills.
The interior design is very appealing. I personally favor the low lighting since I am rather sensitive to bright lights. It provides a comfortable atmosphere I hardly see at any other restaurants.
As far as their menu goes, every single specialty roll I've tried has been prepared adeptly and left me beyond satisfied. My personal favorites are the Screaming Honey, Crazy Roll, and Danaka's Favorite. Not once have I received any sort of sickness after eating here. I top it all off with some delectable Tempura Ice Cream. I definitely recommend it!
And I can't leave out their prices. They're surprisingly affordable for a sushi place. Two rolls and ice cream for two people generally amounts to around $20.
In the end, I definitely recommend Momo Sushi to anyone, whether you're a sushi fan or not. Not only do they offer rolls, they provide other lunch and dinner options which consist of teriyaki chicken and other samples.
I eat here at least once a week! I love there Philadelphia roll and their prices are very reasonable! Nice staff also!
The girlfriend and I came here looking fo some good sushi. Its pretty good kind of expensive for what I thought it was worth. The service there is acceptable
Dark atmosphere perfect for an intimate occasion and the food is amazing. Friendly sushi chefs and fast serving staff.
This place is very clean and the décor is inviting. The sushi chef are more interactive when you sit at the bar. Very appropriate for a date night or any special occasion. Prices are comparable.

Food is always great and the waitresses are really nice people. Love their udon and they have a variety of unique sushi. The amount of wasabi and ginger they give you is also plenty. Great place! They have Korean beer too like Hite!
Went here with a client, her suggestion. I was really impressed! Fantastic food at great prices. Service was fast and friendly. I highly recommend it. And will definitely be going back!
Love this place! Great service and the best sushi! I have been coming here for over 10 years.
The sushi was excellent and the service was great. The service was fast and the four of us enjoyed our meal and sushi at a really great price highly recommended

I had a Rest com coupon so was able to convince my husband to go for lunch.... ( he usually only wants to go to AYCE sushi.) He had the Lunch Special ($8.95) with the Miso soup, other sides, chicken teriyaki and chicken katsu. He thought both chickens were very good, the teriyaki chicken was not fatty and was tender & moist. He loved the Miso soup, thought it was one of the best he had tried at local places. He also had ebi, magura and hamachi nigiri, and thought all tasted fresh. I had the usual embarrassingly named rolls and they were quite tasty. When the older sushi chef had to tell the other chef to make the S on the B roll, they both giggled and shook their heads.... but I got past it and it was good eating! I had been so focused on the menu, that I didn't look up and see the daily special board right in front of me until after ordering... I will be back to try some of those. We sat at the sushi bar and enjoyed watching the chefs create the plates, er.. boats. One boat was made with a fish he filleted as we watched. The final product had what was left of the fish as adornment. Looks much better than it sounds.

Ordered carry out it was ready in 15 minutes. The sushi was great and just as expected! The staff was super friendly and helpful when arriving to pick it up. 
Inside looked nice too while I was there, would love to eat in some time. Definitely recommended.

1st time here and I have to admit it was very very good. Many places here in Vegas don't have live shrimp which I love and this place does. I will definitely be coming back to this place and I think I found my new favorite spot.
Fast and friendly service. Had a yelp voucher and they were happy to accept it. Fair priced and the sushi rolls were yum! Would recommend.
Awesome service & great fresh food! Gotta try Jennifer 2, Momo tower and must try the crunch shrimp! DELICIOUS!!!

The drive is a pain in the butt from my house, but it's SO worth it. I ordered salmon and miso soup, and it was out of this world. I got it as a carry out, and I was so pleased that everything was fresh and the soup was hot when I got home to enjoy it. Friendly staff, clean establishment. I'll definitely go back again.

Fantastic amazing sushi!  Tried this place out for the first time and it's unbelievable. Fresh and delicious with great service. I will definitely be regulars here considering I live down the street. I highly recommend this place.

Had dinner here with my stepdad the other night. Not terrible sushi but I've had better elsewhere. Customer service was very weak especially when my dad did the yelp check-in and she wouldn't accept it because it expired in February! He argued with her on why it's still up if it's expired and after a few minutes she finally apologized and let him use it just "the one time". I definitely won't be back due to the service vs food but it was worth a try!

Really bummed :( that this place wasn't good. Especially when I live in Henderson. Ordered the Kiss of Fire and it was not good at all. It was edible yes, but not that fresh or appetizing. I'm a regular at Sushi Fever on W. Sahara which blows this place out of the water. If anybody that comes here thinks this is good sushi go visit Sushi Fever and you'll see the huge difference. And btw I completely unbiased to both places the food here just wasn't good.  I've had enough sushi over the years to know great sushi and mediocre sushi. The tuna did not look bright and pink it was more brown and pink. The service was meh as well not bad, but not great. 

Also as a side note, BABYSTACKS and Genghis Grill which are right next store are both great!

I've been coming to this place for a while im since I moved it's closer than I.LOVE SUSHI but just as good. There's no AYCE but the quality and service is definitely worth the price. The staff is friendly and attentive, the fish is fresh and generous cuts are given. On weekends they have live scallops and ama ebi which is my favourite , even in the week days they have excellent quality scallops and not the small bay kind either. I am not a roll person I am very picky about my quality sashimi and this place never disappoints. Definitely recommend coming here.
I enjoy Momo Sushi for the great tast of their box meals... the Kalbi is delicious and I love their salad dressing.

Best sushi (for a reasonable price) that I've had in Las Vegas so far. I ordered the Kiss of Fire roll and my date ordered the When Shrimp Meets Crab roll. Both were pretty damn amazing. I recommend both if you're brand new to the place. Fairly small restaurant, but the menu is unparalleled, and the sushi chefs are hilarious and very entertaining to watch.

We are from out of town, yet felt like we were at home here! The wife got trashed with sushi chef James and we finished up with the mango sakitini. Absolute greatness! Some of the best sushi I've ever had! The presentation was beautiful and amazing! The staff was so, so friendly and kind. So fun to drink with too!

We love love love this place! Best service you'll find anywhere. Extremely good with kids. Super nice, very fast service, high quality food. Let's just say their screaming "O" really screams "o soo delicious". I highly recommend this place.
I come here often for there fresh sushi rolls and pretty good rolls. The green tea ice cream is all ways a good desert. The momoyama roll is really good.

Wow!  I think I am becoming a biased reviewer of Momo. The  last item we ordered and received was the Momo Kampachi. What a way to finish off a wonderful meal. 

The staff is warm and welcoming. James the chef as you see from the picture is an artist and I ate his Mona Lisa. Just so fresh and vibrant. The fresh wasabi popes with spice and the super white tuna was so clean tasting with a hint of lemon added. 

All rolls were just a great the standard screaming 'o' is a must in our book. Tuna with ponzu sauce and some mayo which of course is bad but tastes so so good. 

Jon and Julie have made a place we love. We found Momo over a decade ago and are still in love. Friendly people and such great food.

3 stars because the food was really good.  Sit at the bar so the chefs can get your rolls and nigiri to you as it's prepared   The wait staff is slow and overwhelmed with two waitresses tending to the whole restaurant and the bar.   Food is really good tho can't deny how good the Ugly Roll was.   The lunch specials offer a ton of food

I would give Momo Sushi more stars if the service matched the food.

I will be straightforward by saying that the service is horrible. The ladies who work there are extremely grouchy and inattentive. I have given them plenty of chances to change my opinion in the last 6 months and it just hasn't gotten any better. I have to add that I am always friendly to servers and I try to be understanding, so for me to be dissatisfied with service is worth listening to.

Now the food...

The food is pretty good. The sushi is fresh (although could use more variety - a lot of cooked rolls) and the bento boxes/dinner plates are a good option for non-sushi eaters (particularly the kalbi short ribs).The servings are generous and most days good food is enough to get me to come back.

Went there for a Friday night dinner. Great service and amazing food. They don't have AYCE but the prices were not bad at all. Probably the same price we pay for AYCE at other places. Will be going back for sure!

"It's okay to eat fish, because they don't have any feelings..." - Kurt Cobain

I love fish...raw, seared, roasted, deep fried, smoked, whatever. But I have yet to find a "go to" spot here in the valley for good sashimi and sushi. When the wife and I lived down near the east side of Trop, we used to go to Sushi On Tropicana. It was a really good AYCE place, unfortunately it closed. Since moving to Henderson, we have been trying various locations that are just "meh". But, we keep coming back to Momo Sushi. They aren't an all-you-can-eat kind of place, but that's okay, their fish is pretty damned good...fresh, well prepared, delicious.

Located down on Stephanie, right next to Baby Stacks Cafe (excellent breakfast, BTW), right across from Burlington Coat Factory. Very unassuming and dark when you walk in, until you hear the familiar "irasshaimase!" greeting from the sushi chefs...good sized sushi bar and smallish dining room beside it. They do have booths, though. Waitresses are friendly and quick with the drink order, which is nice.

Before I met my wife, I would usually order my sushi nigiri and by the piece...she's introduced me to the world of specialty rolls, spicy mayo and sweet sauces...why not? (Still getting used to the cream cheese thing, though). Momo has an array of specialty rolls, like most places, difference being, these are pretty good sized rolls (maybe making up for the fact they don't do AYCE sushi?). Most are priced in the mid-range of between $8.95 and $14.95.

The wife's favorite is, of course, the Screaming Orgasm (insert girlish giggle here...), seared tuna piled around a mountain of shredded daikon radish surrounded by a moat of spicy garlic ponzu sauce and mayo. Get the large, it's good. My favorites are the Spider Roll, I love soft-shell crab...and the Something Wrong 69 roll, more soft-shell crab with shrimp tempura, topped with an assortment of fish (a little bit of everything, iz oishii). If I still have room at the end of the meal, I'll sometimes skip the mochi ice cream and get the Zaru Soba (buckwheat noodles, served cold). I was pleasantly surprised when I saw it on the menu, it's the perfect way to finish a meal.

So, I don't know if I've found my "go-to" spot yet...but, Momo Sushi is close. If your looking for a good izakaya restaurant/sushi joint, check it out...I just noticed they have Hamachi Kama on the menu, will have get that next time...I love a nice fatty piece of broiled or grilled fish collar.

I got 4 different sushi rolls and they were all good. All the meat was also cooked. My cousin got a tuna sashimi and there were worms on it, not sure what part of the sashimi they came from. The staff believes it was from the bean sprouts.

Went for the lunch special bento box. Decent deal and decent food. Nothing special about it though.

Also, the service could have been better. There were only two tables, including ours, with two waitresses. It still took two attempts to get ginger/wasabi.
Magically delicious! Lol! Tiny spot, but chill, relaxing setting. Really good sushi, miso soup, and sizzling Kalbi. A little pricey, but the taste of food is worth it.

Got the Chirashi bowl for lunch when I was working on this side of town over the summer. The bowl I received was beautifully presented with fresh fish and a good-sized portion of it. I liked most of what I had but don't personally care for their Cajun tuna at all, the seasoning is overwhelming and the texture was hard as if it was recently defrosted. 

Other reviews complain about the service, but I sat at the sushi bar and the chef was polite. When it came time to get my bill, the server was nowhere to be found, but I was one of only two customers. Their menu of rolls is considerable, but I'd probably stick to the same order if I returned.

I live fairly close to Momo and the prices are much better than Globe Fish so it's usually my sushi place of choice.

The rolls are interesting and well put together. I love their negitoro roll (tuna belly with a little piece of green onion). 

Pro:
Clean, cute, good sushi and service

Cons:
I really hate the spicy sauce on the spicy tuna rolls and spicy tuna sashimi. It's my favorite thing to order at most sushi places but Momo's sauce choice is just not for me. The sauce overpowers the flavor of the fish completely

Prices seemed good.
Place looks bigger, now they removed the walls.  Been a long time ago I've ate here.
Sushi - palm tree really good.
Sushi - Alaska roll, not bad
Lunch special - kalbi, under cook, only one slab.  Teriyaki beef, eh.  Salad, I had a half piece tooth pick in there.  I was wondering why my salad had a hard piece in it.  I showed waitress and took pictures to post.  Rice, norm.  Tempura, two pieces only.  One is baked sushi roll?, idk.  Other piece, I don't remember.  Miso good.
Only one server, ask if everything okay, but I rather they just come fill our drinks up.  We had to ask.
One sushi chef behind bar.
Return.  Never.
I would say, no stars.  But one for just still existing this long.  And sushi a ok.

Very good place.  Not an AYCE but the nigiri and roll sizes are very large and filling.   I have had the uni twice here and it was also fresh and delicious.    I would have posted pictures but was too hungry to bother with the camera.  :)

Add AYCE to menu!

There was a restaurant.com deal I picked up a few months back for $100 off $200 tab. I got some friends together (6 of us total) and went down to Henderson to give this place a shot. First off, the menu has photos, that's awesome! Makes me picking my sushi so much easier. We all started off with some warm saki and a few appetizers. When it came to the dinner, we all each, ordered 2 different rolls and just shared. My favorite was the Cherry Blossom, it was AMAZING! After we stuffed our faces with over 12 different rolls, we found out we were still $6 short of our $200 tab. I couldn't believe all of that was still under $200. So at the end, our bill was $144 with the gratuity that is added b/c of the gift certificate. So with that, we got 4 apps, 6 sake's, 6 sappora's, and 12 rolls. Great deal!

Service was good, everything was clean and the sushi was delicious! Everything came out super fast and tasted really good, I'm actually not a huge sushi person because everything I've tasted in the past wasn't amazing, but this place turned me around! Definitely some place to check out after a day of shopping in the nearby shopping centers.

Mo options, Mo flavor, Mo stars! I was nervous to give a new sushi place a try in a city that I don't regularly eat, but Momo was a treat! Centrally located in Boulder City, this is a gem of a sushi restaurant where you wouldn't expect!

I ordered two rolls and miso soup. The miso was great, which is usually hard to mess up, but it was definitely the best miso I've ever had. The highlight of my meal, however, was the Jesty Salmon roll. If you like citrus and salmon, this simple roll will be a big hit with you!

The other roll that I ordered was the dragon roll which was a step out of my comfort zone. It was worth it! Very tasty roll and I would highly recommend it.

Overall, quality and freshness of fish were amazing and I really enjoyed it. The two downsides I found were service wasn't quite as helpful as I'd like and price was pretty high. I think it's difficult to get such fresh fish in that area but it was certainly more pricey than was worth it for the size of portions. 

5/5 Food, 4/5 Location, 3/5 Service, but I would still recommend giving this place a try at least once!

Momo Sushi is my absolute favorite place to go for sushi. I wish they had All You Can Eat, but I'm pretty sure they don't because the quality of the fish is so high! They would definitely lose money on it, haha. I love their sashimi, the sushi chefs here are amazing! I leave always satisfied and happy. Great service, great quality, and super cozy. I have been coming here for over a decade and I will always return.

I've been here a number of times, but one day I decided I had a long day at work doing morning shift and wanted to wind down here for lunch.

I sat at the sushi bar and I was familiar with the staff, my old sushi chef from Yama Sushi was now here (surprise surprise) making my rolls.

I adore the Family Roll and the Leo Ball. The Mochi here is also excellent.

My previous experiences were all good. I had gone with a friend once and they had a super spicy roll. The waitress noticed they were having a hard time with how spicy it was, so she brought us FREE mochi ice cream.

I was expecting good service and good sushi. Few people were in there as it was lunchtime and a weekday.

Regardless of there being multiple sushi chefs and very few customers (4 at most), my rolls weren't made very well and they took a while to arrive, even with help. My drink was constantly empty. And the worst part (and this is why I haven't returned since and didn't give 4-5 stars...), I WAITED OVER AN HOUR AND 20 MINUTES FOR MY CHECK. I must have asked for it in 10 different ways 20 different times to 5 different people...

I was at a loss. I wanted to dine and dash so badly, but I'm not like that. And hell, I haven't even gone back - so maybe I should have.

That was the most ridiculous experience ever and I turn the other way now and go to Sapporo down the street.

BUT...I was told that the head sushi chef here is willing to teach women how to make sushi.
I don't know of anywhere else that is, and the sushi chefs here always tell me women weren't taught how to make sushi for the longest time.
Interesting.

The sushi and sashimi were amazingly delish. I ordered to go and promptly picked up the order. It was well prepared and packaged to look as if they were plated. I was impressed at the attention to detail even with takeout. But more importantly the food was wonderful. The flavors explode in your mouth. Anyways, fresh sushi is the only way to go. It was a little pricey but hey...You're getting fresh food prepared as you order it. We will be back again.

This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in Vegas. It's small and intimate with it never being loud or crazy busy even on a Friday night. Our favorite items are the Sizzling Eel and Dragon Roll with Edamame being our appetizer and using their free ice cream for dessert (you get the coupon upon check in on yelp). For two people, that fills us right up. Quite a hidden gem!
I liked the atmosphere here.  The service was excellent and fast.  I will definitely be back.  I usually opt for all-you-can eat, but if you want a nicer, sit-down place, I recommend here.

I stopped in for lunch on a Sunday and there weren't many people around. The waitress was attentive and friendly. I ordered the lunch special with tonkatsu and shrimp/vegetable tempura which was delicious and filling. I wanted to order sushi, and it's awesome that they had pictures of what their sushi rolls looked like, but as I mentioned, I was too stuffed from eating the lunch special. I'd recommend anyone to stop by Momo Sushi to eat.
The Irish roll is one of the best rolls I've had. The orgasm roll has such an amazing surprising flavor to it. Delicious!!

We tried Momo Sushi for the first time tonight. The food was very good but the service was completely awful! We waited for ever for the food even though no one was there. Neither of the two waitresses had a clue as to what the are doing. We waited forever to get a check When we finally asked for a check (although it was clear we had been done fore some time), they still took another 10 minutes. We probably waited 20-25 minutes for a check so we could get out of there. We will not be back.
Best sushi in the world...amazing service , Everything is so fresh ,Great atmosphere!!

STILL the best $14 eat in Nevada by far! Excellent pricing, excellent quality, excellent prep.....really nice ppl as well....including Greg K. who turned be on to Settabello ...another winner.

CES 2017 - returned as usual and as usual STILL the very best priced eats one can expect, great ambiance, great food, good wine, great prices.... ALWAYS top recommendation.

Service: This, in combination with the food, is why I rate this place with 4 stars. The servers were so kind, polite, and prompt. We also loved the miso soup at the beginning of our meal and the scoop of ice cream at the end. Our drinks were refreshed and they had a smile on their face each time they came by. Yes were full !

I was pleasantly surprised to see that the place was crowded and the sushi bar almost full! I saw the beautiful tuna the chef was apportioning and wrapping well to keep nice and chilled. My friend and I both had the lunch boxes and I shamefully ate everything on my plate!! It was a bit pricey but if it insures fresh fish and well cooked food- then it follows they buy the best top of the line fish.
I read from a chef's diary, that discount sushi bars buy the cheapest quality fish - so I am going by that nugget of inside info.
I am giving this 4 stars because service can be improved. The waitress might be overworked, underpaid and undertipped.
I would go back there again - for sure!!!

Excellent place, we were staying at the Hoover dam lodge and did a Yelp search for sushi.  Menu has a lot of offerings, food was great and service was so pleasant!  I'm Japanese and can be a snob to non-Japanese owned restaurants when it comes to authenticity.  This place satisfied!  Even my picky daughter found her favorite agedashi tofu on the menu!  Prices were reasonable.  We had such a good experience there that the next night, when driving back late from Vegas, we called a to go order in and again got pleasant service.  What a good find for us on our vacation!

Great service, walked in and was immediately greeted in a nice manner. Food is great and comes out extremely fast! Taste is very authentic also! I will definitely be coming back the next time I'm in town!

Great spot for sushi in Boulder City. The service has never disappointed and the food has always tasted delicious. There's not a happy hour and they're only open for dinner, but they do bogo sake! Can't go wrong with that!

I ordered the bento box and the toro sushi man I can't believe how good the food is here!!  The staff are very nice the food is very fresh and the lunch price is very fair.  I definitely recommend this place, I don't give 5 stars unless the place meets my criteria which are, nice staff, cleanliness, fresh food, deep fried food are not oily, and if they have the authentic traditional Japanese style food. This place met all of it...

Their sushi isn't really anything special. You can get it just about anywhere.

We went there tonight, and wanted to order Tuna belly sashimi. Our waitress told me they didn't have it.... Because it was too expensive. One might think that they would take it off the menu... Or say that it sold out.

Our dessert was brought before dinner was over, and the tempura ice cream tasted odd. The ice cream looked pink, and there were red dots in it. 

The waitress told us it was 'vanilla'. She told me the pink was from the batter. Maybe I need to brush up on my tempura....... Because I thought it is suppose to be golden brown and delicious

Went here today with some friends. We arrived at lunch time and had a big group, 10 people, but surprisingly this place was pretty empty. So we were seated right away. We usually go to AYCE places, but the pricing here for not being AYCE was very reasonable and the food was of high quality. We had 1 lunch bento that came with miso soup, side salad, 2 entree items (chicken teriyaki and kalbi was what we ordered) and rice. We also ordered 3 rolls, and age dashi and the "rolls rice ball" and our bill came to $59. The "rolls rice ball" was amazing, was rice with fish and sauce mixed in, so a roll in a place. All the other rolls were very tasty as well. Definitely will go back to this place to try more items. I had to knock off some points though for the service. The waitress sighed and rolled her eyes when we said it would be 3 separate tabs, and she seemed to have a hard time keeping the orders straight. The other thing she did, which kind of shocked us all, was when asking if my friend wanted a refill, she grabbed the glass from her while she was mid drink to go refill it. Right out of her hand. My husband told me later that another waitress apologized for her and said that she was upset because 2 servers called out sick so she was called in. Sorry but that's her issue, one that shouldn't be taken out on the customer. Hopefully the service will be better next trip.

Went for the first time at Momo Sushi and I am not impressed and happy with their customer  service. For a Sushi lover, I have eaten and visited a lot of Sushi establishments in different states and here at home. The food is good but the service lacked. When we arrived the reception from the staff was very strained. It's as if sating "hello" or "welcome" was too much work for them. 
We were sat by the server and each of us were given menus. Since it was our first time, we were reading, very carefully the menu so we can make good decisions in what to eat. Server came to take our orders more than once. I told her we needed more time but she kept coming back really fast without allowing us to have time to decide. We felt rushed. 
After we ordered and our food delivered, you'd think that they will come back to check up on us and see if we needed our glasses re-filled with our beverages. No one did that. I was parched and I had to get someone's attention to get my glass of water refilled. Could it be that I only had water and not Soda or an alcoholic beverage? Whatever the reason, I feel that I shouldn't have to flag someone that many times to get my glass of beverage refilled. 
The food was good but I've eaten better in other establishments that are cheaper who also gave us better service than they. 
The place is simply not friendly and welcoming. 
To return to this place will not happen again. Not a  recommendation to anyone. 
I give them two thumbs down.

Was impressed with this place.  Decided to try out a new sushi spot, which is always a scary thing to do but this place did not disappoint!!!

Sushi chefs were very friendly and very funny...the food was VERY good, and for the price and variety...you cant beat it.  

We will totally be back!
LOVE this place! Great sushi and super nice!! A weekly spot for me !!
The sushi is amazing. The Ugly Roll is absolutely delicious. The restaurant is small but cozy and their sushi bar is on point. Plenty of choices for everyone!!
Hit and miss but overall pretty good. The service is often lacking but the food is so darn good we still make a visit every so often. The teriyaki chicken is a must try.

The staff is friendly and the fish is fresh. It can get expensive if you're hungry since they don't have AYCE. I had salmon and albacore nigiri, both good. Also the Triple A Roll, Momo soft shell crab roll & Japanese Nachos. I liked the Triple A, the other two were just ok.

Momo Sushi is above the rest!!! We have been coming here for years, and have NEVER had a bad experience. We live SOOOO far from it now, but still make time to stop by anytime we are on this side of town! We've tried a lot of different sushi spots trying to find something closer, but after u've had momo it is so hard to settle for anything else!! Our favorite rolls: Irish roll, Mexico City Roll, Ugly Roll. WE LOVE MOMO!!!
Very tasty and exquisite sushi. Pleasant and friendly staff. Beautiful interior. True, prices are too high. I advise you to visit a sushi lover.

I moved to Vegas from Arkansas, where I had not one but three sushi places that i absolutely adored. The move to Vegas meant no sushi or sushi dates with my best friend, but I seemed to have gotten extremely lucky. 
A friend of mine took me to this place after disagreeing with the main place I picked because it had a drive through and I fell so in love. My roll was delicious and so was his. I actually had him go back a few weeks later to get me some Miso soup because I forgot to try and I loved that too!! I will definitely be back.
Timely service and great food! Short distance from home, worth the trip. Buy one get one free hot sake!!!

Cute, small place. Prices are reasonable/average. Our waitress wasn't able to tell us what was in some of the rolls when we asked, not a huge deal. Ordered the kara-Age, Yam, California & dynamite rolls. Kara-Age was delicious, came served with 5 pieces, mayo and Cajun salt dry spice to dip. The California roll was decent, normally sized. The Yam & Dynamite rolls in the other hand were so MASSIVE it was hard to eat a single piece without almost choking or having it completely fall apart in your plate. Taste was good, size, not so good for eating. The only rolls that seemed to be small were the lower prices rolls (veggie) guess the more you pay the bigger it was. Price for the Maki sushi ranged from $2.50(avocado  roll) to just over $11(Spider roll).

We've been here several times. Always seated in the back room. If they seat you there expect to be forgotten. Orders take about 15 minutes to place, have to ask for utensils, and food comes out at all different times. We will not be back which is unfortunate since its right down the road from our house.  Momo I hope you guys change for your own benefit. Las Vegas isn't far enough away that we won't drive for good service and excellent sushi.


                           ***UPDATE***
2 of 4 members of our party received their food and were done eating before the other 2 received theirs. Not once were we checked on to see if we needed anything or even apologize. Finally had to hunt down the waiter and ask if the other two meals were coming.  I tried to cancel them but they were "being made right now"  They boxed up the meals and we took them home.  Not so much as a sorry or care about the situation. 


Do not get seated in the back room.
This is one of our favorite lunch spots. They have a lunch platter that you can choose what items you would like. We've never had a bad combination. You also get miso soup with your lunch.

I've been going to MOMO for many years.  It is the closest thing I have to a "home" sushi place.  I'm eternally impressed with the quality of the fish and the friendliness of the staff.  We've gotten to know Jhonny (yes, it's spelled that way) the owner and even see him around Henderson, giving it an even more local feel.  The sushi chefs are fairly consistent and are quick to suggest things not on the menu.  We are sushi purists (always prefer sashimi to anything resembling catfood and/or covered in "yumyum" sauce!) and usually go in and request "the best fish you have."  This can be dangerous for the wallet at times -- but always results in luscious, large chunks of fish. 

I've grown especially fond of the AJI (spanish mackerel sashimi).  The body of the fish (skeleton, tail & head) are used as a serving plate for the sashimi.  After you are finished, the take the fish body, fry it up, and reserve it to you as a crispy snack.

In town on business and had to have my sushi. Found this place online and headed over. In short, the 2 rolls I had, the galleria and white horse were quite good and the shumai was well made but the service was poor. I was seated at the bar right away and then waited for about 10 minutes to be asked if I wanted a drink. It was not at all busy. It was not even 5 pm. My shumai appetizer was forgotten so it was not provided timely. Sushi Chef was very personable but made one roll and I waited about 15 minutes or more to get the other. Huh? I eat a lot of sushi at a lot of places and they always prepare my rolls and present as a platter. 

Anyway, good food poor service. Pleasant people as well. I might try them again just to see if it was a bad day.

This small Japanese restaurant is hidden in a small bank of restaurants near the corner of Stephanie and Power Center. The food is authentic, reasonably priced and plentiful. Well prepared and presented, the tempura is light and crisp, not greasy. The sushi choices are popular and well known to anyone who frequents sushi bars regularly. The only area to improve is the service. While it is fast and efficient, if the waitresses can inject a little friendliness or even crack a smile, it would greatly improve the diners' experience here.

Great place!! My family of four walked in the same time three big parties walked in. Service was speedy. Food was delicious. We ordered California roll, spicy crab roll, spicy tuna roll, Mexico City roll, Irish  and teriyaki chicken.  All were great!! Highly recommend!!!

Inconsistent service, beverages and food. Something is always different and a lot of times service is slow because there is always a new untrained waitress. The owner takes tips from the workers and finds it appropriate to yell or cuss at them while customers are present. Very unprofessional. I won't bother going here again.

I've been here twice for dinner and once for take out. All three times the sushi is yummy. They have some pretty imaginative rolls. Staff is very friendly, although once our service was very slow and both times eating in the table and benches have been sticky. Let's hope that doesn't have anything to do with how clean their kitchen is.

Sushi was yummy and staff was great!
I had never been before and got the roll that has the cucumber instead of rice. Very yummy!:)

I had the lunch special. Very reasonable price. My combination was teriyaki salmon and tempura. The rest came with the lunch special. Also not shown in this picture...miso soup. Everything was very delicious. Very busy for lunch. They need to hire another server.
Like coming to this place during lunch and with my co worker, great food! Recommend this place!

Maybe this place is great for locals/regulars. But as someone who stopped in while visiting based on reviews. I was not impressed.

Service was terrible. I walked in a little after 6 on a Sunday, no aknowledgement of me being there, after about 5 minutes I was finally seated. I decided what I wanted, 10 minutes later someone came over and asked if I wanted a drink. I ordered a drink and before I got a chance to let her know I was ready to order my food she walked away.

..waited another 10 minutes, my water came, plopped on the table and half of the water spilled out of the glass.

Here is our convo of me ordering:
Me: Im ready to order now
Waitress: What do you need now?
Me: Id like to order my dinner
W: OK, do you want *insert her rattling off random things here*
M: No, I just want these two rolls and a small screaming "o"
W: You sure you dont want more?
M: No thank you

Seriously.. why are you pushing more food on me. Sorry I wont be that big of a tab since its just one person, but that was tacky.

It took about 25 minutes for my food to come out.

The food was OK, nothing great. I wont come back.

I love the new addition to Boulder! The food and service were amazing . Our food came out quickly and was very fresh tasting . Our waitress was very sweet and helpful. The kiss of fire is probably one of our new favorite rolls. The prices were extremely competitive compared to other places in henderson . Since they're still new, they have a lot of specials running . The house sake made for a great sake bomb . Overall,  it was a great place to get sushi in town.

I've been here a few times now and both times have thoroughly enjoyed myself. When it comes to sushi, I don't do rolls or fried crap so a place needs to offer something special for me to be impressed. Here are some of the things I've loved...

(1) Service. Both times the service has been great and the chefs have been fairly chatty. I really got to know the guy the last time I went.
(2) Baby Octopus Salad - This dish is just yummy. Healthy strips of baby octopus with sesame seeds and not sure what else but I scarf it down.
(3) Uni shooter. I love an Uni Shooter so if a place offers it I'm in.
(4) Live Shrimp - I first discovered this awesome treat in CA. They cut the live shrimp in front of you and serve you the tail meat. They then take the head, flash fry it, and you eat it. SOOOOOOO sweet and yummy!
(5) They always have specials. I love a place that offers stuff off the menu. It shows they care and are trying to be inventive.

I'm not sure why there are bad reviews but they were all from a while back so maybe things have improved. Of all the places I've been in Las Vegas, outside of say Tao or Yellowtail type places, this is by far my favorite. It definitely makes a happy ending to an afternoon of shopping.

Super excited about having a sushi place in Boulder City.  We enjoyed a couple of rolls and a few rounds of nigiri and it was all very good and very reasonably priced.  I'll definitely be coming back.

One word: Lunch special....wait TWO words. Haha.

Decided to hit up this place cause it's down the street from my work and it was a short lunch for me. Got the lunch special - their lunch special you get: miso soup, salad, and two of the meat items -- I got the chicken teriyaki and tonkatsu. 

I put my order in and had my co-worker pick it up, apparently on their menu, you're supposed to get gyoza, tamago and inari sushi. But I didn't get that. Oh well.

Price is decent and quality is okay. Would come back to try out their rolls.
I love this place!! Their screaming O, ultimate tuna, something wrong... oh! And Garlic Tuna!  I love the server, we are regulars here!

My friends and I enjoy this place very much! The staff is welcoming and friendly and it is always a good time whenever we come in. Simon is our favorite chef at the sushi bar and the food always tastes excellent!

Ordered the Momo and Seafood bentos. Tastes good, but I've definitely had just as good or better elsewhere for less $$$. The sushi was messy and poorly put together.

GF says to add that she really liked the age dashi tofu. Yes, I agree. That was good.
Favorite neighborhood spot. Great fish and the wait staff is so sweet always a fave !
Our favorite sushi place in Henderson. We love the sushi chefs & will only eat here when on this side of town.

Great atmosphere as you walk in. You are greeted by smiling staff. Seemed pretty busy in the dining area for a Sunday night. I placed an order to go and it was already waiting for me when I got there. My kids love California Rolls so I ordered five. The rolls tasted very fresh. The kids give this place two thumbs up! Will visit again.

Great place with great sushi and service. Came here with my girlfriend, we usually do the all you can eat places. This was extraordinary compared to all the sushi places we've had around here in Las Vegas. Love the vibe and food; definitely recommend it! Niki served us and was super friendly and helped us out.

Just got takeout from here. I got the rock and roll, Irish, and stuffed tomato. A little spicier than most places, but still super good. Fresh fish and cucumber. I was here one other tomw but all i got was a cucumber salad and miso soup. Both delicious. Miso soup was amazing. I stood at the door for a while while everyone kind of looked at me, then a sushi chef yelled "CUSTOMER!!!" and everyone came up to me at once. There was a woman helping a little girl with math at one of the tables. Guessing it's a family owned joint. The sushi was delicious though, and I'll definitely be back.
Great sushi !!Nicky our waitress was very sweet !!food was great and fresh.The fish was excellent and was able to try new items..
We come to Momo's for dinner at least twice a month.  The food is great, the sushi fresh and the staff friendly.  Our go to Japanese restaurant!

I absolutely love this place. Great food (I love their ice cream) and very personable staff. I know some have complained about the service being slow, which has never seemed to bother me, but it is absolutely worth the wait! 5 stars.

I frequently come here when I visit my parents in Henderson and usually get take out. Great service, love their menu and fish is fresh and delicious! Would highly recommend if you are in the Henderson area looking for some good sushi!

This place is a whole in the wall. Food is fresh and of very good quality. Nikki was our waitress and she was awesome....she made sure everything was good with our food abs accommodated every single wired request we had. Only thing that some people might not like is that it's not an all you can eat place! Will definitely come back again

we tried this place based on reviews.  we already love sumo sushi over on green valley and wanted to see if this place measured up.  nope.  didn't cut it.  good but not great.  went there trhee times to make sure but we'll stick to sumo for our love of sushi!

The sushi is fresh and yummy! I've been here many times and the staff are always pleasant and the sushi is consistently scrumptious! Although this place does not have ayce it still should not be overlooked as a sushi option! If anything, the reason why their quality of fish is better than a lot of other place is because it does not have ayce. I would go here everytime for sushi but it's in Henderson and I live in Vegas. 

The interior is well decorated and has a calming vibe, a cute place to bring a date for sure. Imo this is probably one of the best places in town. The prices are reasonable, the fish is quality, and try the jesty salmon roll! ^_^
The sushi was really high quality along with their beef and chicken. The wait staff is very nice.
Absolutely love it! best sushi I've had in Las vegas so far! Big, hearty rolls, i love it and make an effort to get down there weekly, i live in summerlin but it's worth the drive!!
Stopped in at Momo's because of the great reviews and was not disappointed. The miso soup was great, followed by the Henry and Orion rolls. Will definitely come by here again next time I'm in town!

While running errands on a Saturday afternoon, my boyfriend and I stopped here for lunch. It was relatively slow/empty, but had great reviews on yelp, so we decided to give it a shot!  

The most important thing to mention is that almost all of their rolls feature crab mix, which I don't eat.  If you're like me, this place is not for you. If they are not busy, they will customize, but I get embarrassed when I have to do that.  We ordered two rolls and they were just okay; their sushi rice is kinda bland compared to others.  If you want awesome sushi, go to Tokyo Boys down the street.
We love it here. The atmosphere it here amazing. The staff is really nice. The sushi is spectacular. We are regulars now!!!

This review is long overdue...
So my boyfriend and I decided to try this place on a whim early last year...and we were pleasantly surprised! 
The food is fresh and delicious! We had the Ugly Roll, Screaming Honey, Palm-tree Roll, Sex on the Beach, Something Wrong 69, and When Shrimp Meets Crab. I would give the food 5 stars. The service, I would give 3.5 stars. The atmosphere, 3.5 stars as well. The waitresses are a little pushy and seem to rush you out as soon as you're done eating. The establishment itself is a little too dim for my liking and it's a little sloppy looking in my opinion - it looks more like someone's house rather than a restaurant. But overall, I would recommend this place for sushi if you're in the Green Valley area! We've been back multiple times ever since our first visit!

Good sushi, good service, highly recommended! Our server was attentive and courteous. The chef was very engaging, the restaurant was clean and overall, people seemed to enjoy themselves. I will be back!!

The sushi is ok, but nothing special. The spicy edamame is not good! It is so salty it is inedible. The waitresses greet you and serve promptly, but they pick up the dishes with the same velocity! I felt rushed and as if I was being kicked out. I don't know if I will be coming back here.

Normally I always go to "all you can eat" sushi places only because I like to go and try different rolls. I went to Momos (which does not offer all you can eat and I knew that before going) and WOW what a difference it was from AYCE sushi. The service was amazing and the waitresses always made sure you had water and anything else you needed without being too clingy to the table and trying to get you in and out. The food was delicious and everything the waiter recommended was sooo good! The baked mussels were my favorite but even all of the rolls we had tasted so good! I would HIGHLY recommend this place and will definitely be back soon! It was worth paying more for the taste!

This place is amazing! I got to watch shrimp get drunk in a glass of sake... Literally 2 huge live shrimps in a glass filled with sake splashing around... Super interesting. The rolls are great. Service is great. All around awesome experience. We will go back. If you're in the area give this place a try!
Overall good service good food at a reasonable price. Everything was really good the Oriental box was amazing

This is one of the very best sushi restaurants I've ever been to. The fish is cut so beautifully, your teeth sink right in. The portions are very generous. There aren't a million rolls to choose from but what they do offer is delicious and fresh. We always get the salmon Kama too! This dish takes about a half hour to get to our table but it is so worth the wait. Crispy, fatty and oh so tasty! Taylor is an amazing and intuitive server who will make suggestions for you if you like. It's my favorite restaurant in Boulder City.

Very good food I eat here often, hot & cold dishes. A friendly staff always gives a rousing "konnichiwa"" or "konbonwa" (good afternoon or evening) as you enter.  The atmosphere is great - once inside it's easy to forget about the outside world as the windows are tinted dark and Japanese screens hide the parking lot.  The decor is warm and traditional.  There is a nice flat screen behind the sushi bar that doesn't interfere and usually plays sports.

Overall excellent experience, especially for Henderson. Nigiri was fresh and specialty rolls were delicious and unique, we had some of both. Service was excellent and we were well taken care of. Price was average for the area, but in my opinion about 1-2 dollars too high across the board. I strongly recommend it.
