Momo Sushi is always a good choice for lunch. Stopped in over the weekend and had a roll with some bento boxes. Everything was delicious as usual. We will be back again for lunch. Never been here for dinner but perhaps we will come in sometime to try.

Fresh and delicious sushi and sashimi. I really love the ikura here. I think they marinate it so it has nice soy flavor that pairs well with the saltiness of the balls in your mouth. Heehee. They have complimentary cucumber salad when you sit at sushi bar. 

If you head there for lunch you can get a 2 choice bento box for under 9 bucks. I always get salmon teriyaki and tempura combo. So tasty! They have lots to choose from. Comes with miso soup, gyoza, salad and rice.

Highly recommended if you're in the Henderson area.
My favorite sushi place around! Mexico City roll is my go to! Their menu has pictures of all the rolls and helps if you aren't sure what you are getting yourself into with unique rolls.

I called to see if this place is "Japanese" owned and asked TWICE. The girl responded YES TWICE. Well, she LIED! I was pretty pissed and after we left, I gave a $3 tip (dollar per person).
I don't appreciate when people lie as it was Korean owned and they don't have the knowledge to cook Japanese food. Of course, most people don't know the difference between Japanese and Korean (except for Asians). And on top of that you can tell by the atmosphere that it's not Japanese....Never again.......

Bombtastic! 3 alarm FIRE roll disgustingly good. Kiss of fire sexieness! Dont worry is bomb bomb. Irish roll sooooo my goodness! Sushi chef was delightful friendly. Waitress sweet n on it! Will return asap

The sushi was good, but the waitress never came back to check if we needed anything else. We placed our empty glasses to get a refill but they we not paying attention. I don't recommend this place because the service was awful.

Sushi was good.  Service was lacking.  They had many interesting rolls to choose from.  We picked about 8-10 rolls.  We way over ordered.  It worked out though because a couple of our rolls never came.  They eventually got taken off the bill.  The only time our server came around was to rush us.  Never when we actually needed something like refills or forgotten rolls.  We felt rushed the whole time we were there.  There were other open tables and we were still eating so I'm not sure what the big deal was.  They have lunch specials that look pretty good.  I would go back to try that if I was in the area but wouldn't go out of my way.

Hands-down the best tasting best quality sushi in this area. Environment is clean. Staff is efficient service is good. Prices are a little high but you get what you pay for and it's worth it. Lunch specials are really worth coming in for.
One of my favorite places to eat good food good service great sushi. Try the Momo box it's wonderful
Finally!! We don't have to leave Boulder City to get good sushi. Awesome food and an amazing staff!
Meh, totally forgettable. I've had much worse and much better. If your in a pinch come here, but was hesitant to consume raw fish.

Like what some other reviewers have said, service here is pretty spotty. We were only a party of 2 so as long as we had our waters and orders correct, that's all I cared about. Pretty much you come in, place your order, they give you your food, you eat, pay for your bill and leave.
Sure, the spicy tuna rolls and this other sushi roll my friend and I ordered were delicious but damn...the price was pretty expensive. $10-12 for spicy tuna rolls!? Come on now.... Then again...look at where Momo Sushi is located at: Henderson. There are plenty of other sushi places especially on the West side/Chinatown that have better prices.

The only reason why we came here for lunch was because we were in the area and we were craving for sushi.
Went in for lunch and found that they are top of the line in making sushi.  It was one of the best sushi restaurants I have ever been in.  So yummy.

It's my second time to  joined this place.  First time was 16 years ago, when there was only few places in Vegas that serves Japanese food.  I'm so disappointed, this time.  Everything I ate this time was no good.  I'm pretty sure it was not my not my taste buds. I had AYE sushi. Tried the sushi which I think that are salable but didn't like it at all!  The calamari looks like tofu and rubbery.  Service was ok.

The service was horrible!  We were the only table and got decent service then a crowd of rowdy women came in and we were nonexistent.  It took us over 30 min to get our check and that was after I  had to walk up to the front counter. 
The food was decent but will probably not go back. I don't like to be in an establishment where I'm treated like I'm a bother than welcomed. 
Being a prior food server I was very disappointed at the quality of service.
Love love love this place! Sushi and service is fabulous. A must if you are a sushi lover
Excellent food, excellent service and they're fast! Every thing came fast and sushi tasted very fresh! !

The service at this place is awful. The hosts/servers don't seem to know how to communicate or know what they are doing. I asked them for a table 3 times and each time they tried sitting me at the bar. It's like they forgot they had already spoken to me and I was the only one waiting for a table. Then a different group came in and they tried sitting them before us. Both I and the other group had to inform them that my group was waiting first. They need a better system to sit people. They also got our food orders wrong. The sushi is good but I probably won't be going there anymore because it's not worth the hassle of dealing with the host/servers.

So bummed. I used to love this place, it's right by me and I used to go all the time. Haven't been in months so we went again and it was no bueno. The rice was mushy and the rolls, I don't know, just not like they used to be. It's a shame, and I hope it was a fluke, but the most recent time was not great.
Get the Screaming Orgasm!!! The best! And most awkward recommendation ever. Everything was good and fairly priced. Friendly staff. One of the best sushi joints I've ever been to and I'm from LA.

Moved here from CA about a year ago, and have been trying to find great sushi since we got here- we finally found it! We have tried lots of places, even tried AYCE, and were not impressed until we tried Momo. Started with a few sashimi plates to see how fresh the fish was, and wow was it fresh!  We then tried a couple rolls and some simple sushi and it was all really good. Can't wait to go back! Our server Maria was fantastic too.

Love this place. They don't have the typical all you can eat but the quality of every roll is so good it doesn't matter. The chefs are pretty cool and it's a pretty decent place to watch a game at their bar.

I'll admit that I was skeptical about finding good sushi in the desert :) but this was pretty darn great.  First off the menu is so entertaining!! It had things like the 'Heart Attack' roll and the 'Screaming Orgasm'.  I had two rolls that were both delicious and fresh tasting. My friends also cleared their plates and everything I tasted of theirs was awesome.  The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because the service was kind of hit or miss. Our food arrived in strange orders - like our appetizer was almost the last thing to arrive and our rolls came out so that some of us were eating and other weren't.  Overall, a great place and I can overlook the service because the food was so tasty.

We visited this place on Boxing Day, despite our attempts to get into Globefish @ Chinook.

We were immediately greeted and seated by a couple of friendly waitresses. They were very quick and prompt with their service.

The menu at Momo Sushi had the average items you would see in most sushi restaurants, nothing special jumped out at me when I saw it. The prices were average, much like if you went to other sushi joints along MacLoed Trail.

I ordered some nigiri-zushi and a California roll, and finished with a couple bowls of refreshing miso soup. The sushi was fresh enough for me to eat it with very little to no soy sauce, but wasn't inspiring enough for me to compare it to the sushi I've had at other places. Finally I finished my meal with green tea ice cream, which doesn't get any better or worse in this city.

Overall Momo sushi hits the spot if one was looking for a simple and filling meal after a day of shopping. I just wish that they had their own special rolls that stood out or a "freshest fish" menu like Wa's has. It feels like they need to put on a leather jacket and scream "forget those clowns across the street! come party with us!!"
Absolutely love this place. Been coming here for years. Always happy with the outcome. Fresh seafood and the staff is always on point.

Momo Sushi has taken over as the only place I find worth spending my hard earned money at to eat. Between the amazing cuts of fish, beyond exceptional customer service and very reasonable prices, I can't talk myself into going anywhere else when I go out to eat. The amount of personal attention received every time I visit keeps me coming back.

went here for the first time and enjoyed several of their rolls. not Bad. My problem is that I was there to relax and eat sushi. There was maybe 5 or 6 older guys in there getting pretty drunk at the sushi bar and then entered a loud and drunk woman. They all started hitting on her, got shot down and then left. Then the woman announced her sexual preference (which does not bother me)  and announced very loudly to a couple at the bar that she was going to get the girl (the one on the date) before the guy would. I am very far from being a prude or shy but this became very awkward. I thought that the 3 guys behind the bar would stop it, but did not. Hopefully, this was an isolated thing because I'd like to go there and relax. Sorry, do not know the results of the showdown. LOL!
Itz tiny,  but our family likes it. Great sushi & VERY fresh sashimi. Yum! Your Yelp check in will get you a scoop of green tea ice cream.

I really enjoyed the lunch special. It's a lot of sushi for a very reasonable price. I also got a free dessert for checking in, which I love. Red bean ice cream - my favorite! We tried the saké and the Japanese beer. I love places that offer authentic tastes of their culture.
First time here today, and it was good! Will be back for sure! California rolls are only 5$ and they are super good, we also had the crazy roll which is shrimp tempura with eel sauce and white fish

I visited here for the first time recently, I was impressed with the flavors of the rolls and the quality of the food. The atmosphere is a bit lacking, and I felt the price was too high. Overall it's a very good place for sushi, but you can definitely get the same quality for a better price.

Was actually surprised that being across the road from chinook more people don't know about this but I guess it's the parking etc that makes it a bit tricky . Nice and quiet and good combo rolls . The pieces of sushi are larger then most in town . The prices are average . The sushi chefs even welcome you and say goodbye . The service is great and stylish
If the fish is gray throw it away, I think they said this at the OJ Simpson trial, but the same sentiment should be said here. YUCK! Don't waste your money.

I am going here Saturday night with the 'rents. So I will write more about this place later but this review will be on the 3 times in the past I've been here.  This place is freakin' awesome :)  Staff - friendly, fast: food - fresh, amazing ;)
These people have it down!  They have this particular roll I love but I cannot remember the name (Tina's fatty roll??)  when I eat there Sat I'll (of course) get it & write about it some more ;)
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Damn parents & I didn't go on Sat so I'll never get the name of that roll!!!  WAHHHHH!
My favorite sushi place in Las Vegas. Everything is always super fresh and delicious. We go here for all our special occasions. My favorite is the Hawaiian roll and Marcs roll
Great service, menu and variety. The sushi is fresh and always delicious. My go to place for sushi in the Henderson area.

Awesome, unexpected spot that has good quality sushi and drinks. Went here with my wife for a little lunch date and enjoyed the food, drinks and staff, very much. We have been back for dinner on several occasions with our son who is into sushi and he gave it a thumbs up.

Fortunately, every time we have returned, we haven't had the issues that other reviewers have had. I would recommend this spot for a sushi and sake fix. We look forward to returning.

This little place has excellent sushi rolls. The rolls are large and fluffy, melt in your mouth. The prices are compatible with similar sushi places in Vegas except the rolls are actually really good and fresh. The chef is a master sushi chef that knows how to roll with care. The service is fast, the staff are friendly, and the portions are just right. If I ever come back to Vegas I would drive down just for a sushi roll.

Best Sushi place in all of Henderson!  There fish is the freshest I have eaten in the middle of the desert with no "fishy" taste at all!   If your new to sushi go with the Screaming O and a triple A roll.  You will not be disappointed!
My all time favorite sushi place. They treat us like family here! Love you guys! I highly recommend the hooters roll. Amazing quality

I decided to have sushi again after being pregnant for 9 long months, so I decided to give this joint a try since it was close to home. The atmosphere is chill & our waitress was very helpful. I tried two of their special rolls, the kiss of fire and Johnny Roll. The kiss of fire roll was good, but it lacked heat in which I was really looking forward too. I've had the kiss of fire roll from Sakana sushi, so I was expecting some good heat from Momo's version , after all it is called the "Kiss of Fire" right???? The Johnny Roll was good as well. Other than the above, overall it was a good restaurant and the rolls are a good sized portion, so I can't really complain.

Where the heck did the 5 stars come from? Either shill posts or those that know no better. 

Quaint little place. Greeted promptly, nice enough waitress.

I paid $13.95 for one roll plus an extra cheezy dollar to swap a few razor thin slices of questionable tuna out for razor thin questionable salmon on a roll after the waitress asked the "boss" if they needed to up-charge for the substitution. I would have given him $5 if he is hurting that bad. 

My sushi chef did a good job with what he had to work with and put it up quickly. The wasabi was totally bland. The poor guy looked like someone put an anchor on his heart. Could be the "boss" or the somber environment or maybe just nap time.  

Nigiri and roll pricing is exorbitant and the inventory in the cold case was sparse....and questionable. You can't charge super premium prices on Nigiri and serve shoddy proteins. 

Boulder City can be fickle....if enough folks get turned off, and you can't make it on the few and far between travelers...guess what? You're toast, that's what. 

I would drive to Vegas in rush hour and pay more for a decent cut. Never again!

Shrimp Tempura udon and Screaming Orgasm (yikes that felt awkward typing).  Shrimp Tempura great size for the price (9.95).  Only problem I found is the tempura is placed in the soup prior to arriving at the table, and therefore it was soggy and was falling apart.  Screaming Orgasm has a small and a large option, and comes on a bed of shredded radish (daikon).  Heavy sauce but it gives it a good flavor.  Overall the service is quick, but there were two times that the communication fell apart and two items did not make it to our table without a reminder that we were waiting for items.  If you get your items and are missing anything, it is best to just assume they may have forgotten or communication broke down, so give a friendly reminder.  They did not react rudely or condescending; very apologetic and moved with haste to get it to us.

Pictured:  Jhonny's Special Roll (ordered by someone in our party.  And yes, the spelling is what was on the menu).

Came in at about 7 p.m. and got seated right away.

The waitress was nice and very attentive to us, we hadn't been in before so she explained the menu and answered our questions.

The food quality was really good, the portions were fair for the prices, and everything was ideal.

GREAT sushi. HORRIBLE service! The waiter spilled water all over our table and after coming to our table three times after that I had to ask him to please wipe it down or bring me napkins for me to do it. If you want good sushi, but do not mind bad service this is the place for you.

It was decent and not crowded. The quality is good, the service a bit slow. We at at the Bar and chef was attentive. He even made the crab nigiri we asked for. I gave it two stars because there are others that, when I eat sushi, I can't stop saying "mm". This place didn't have that oomph for me, unfortunately.

5 starts for the food, everything was amazing, fresh and delicious. Is not overpriced and they have a lot of tasty options. The service could be better, we had to be waiting and waving to the waitress to get their attention. They forgot some stuff in our order but it wasn't a big deal since everything else was really good. 
I just happened to check in and I discovered a coupon on yelp, when I mentioned it to the server she didn't seem happy about it. The food was so goo that I will go back again and again and won't care about the service :) I can keep getting my own napkins, plates etc from other tables.

I absolutely LOVE this place!  Fresh food, friendly and fun staff, and then there is the Ultimate Tuna Roll...the best thing I have ever eaten.  Ever.  Anywhere. They have a big variety of rolls to choose from, so finding something that calls to you isn't hard to do...not over-eating is the hard part.

We have tried a few sushi restaurants in the Henderson area since it's nice and close to Boulder City.  The best by far is Momo's.  The staff is so friendly, every roll we have had is fresh and flavorful.  We keep trying others, but none of them exceed the quality of Momo's.

My husband and I love this place! The food is excellent and the prices are great! We love Megun one of the servers there. She knows us by name and remembers what we drink even though we only eat there maybe once a month. Love this place!
First time here, giving Momo Sushi five stars, great sushi great service, good price...

Hidden little gem! Was out in Boulder City for a class and decided to check out a local spot before heading back into town. Prices are great, Sushi was excellent, Tempura was excellent, very crowded and not much space in the place but we now know why. Will definitely stop by again when we are in BC! You should bring this to Las Vegas!
Great little gem, absolutely awesome sushi. Had the Screaming O, Tara's Fatty Roll and s yellow tail steak. Fantastic, you gotta try this place.
First customers at the new boulder city location. And everything was awesome. Very happy man

Probably the best sushi you'll find in Henderson in my personal opinion. Quick fast service, friendly people, great vibe when you eat indoors at the location. It's dark and cozy with great decor. The specialty rolls are delicious and good quality of fish.

Works of edible art are served here. I recommend the Somethings Wrong. The blend of tuna, salmon, crab, and shrimp are perfect. It is served with a delicate sauce that enhances the experience. The wait staff and chefs are friendly and efficient! We will definitely do this again soon!
I Love this place and our chef Jay! Ask for the Toro sashimi and the poke salad. We always have fun!
I enjoyed every bit of dishes at Momo:) Tonkatsu and beef steak were so delicious, and the price was very reasonable.  I'd like to come here to eat Japanese food!!!

It was our first time here but it has now been declared our new sushi spot! It was absolutely delicious! Sit at the bar and ask for Eric! He was a really cool dude and took good care of us. Food was great and service was awesome! I definitely recommend it. Stop reading this review and just go!! Lol

Being hundreds of miles from the ocean I was not expecting great sushi and I was pleasantly surprised. The quality of their sushi at this restaurant is by far some of the best I've ever had. The service was incredible and they had a wide variety of really original rolls with very unique flavors. It's tucked away in old town Boulder so you will need directions. It's a small restaurant with seating for 20-30 maybe. The decor could use a little refresh. But it's clean and very well kept. Their Sushí is really exceptional. Enough that I would consider making the drive from the Vegas strip especially if it was a busy weekend or visit the Hoover Dam and stop for dinner on the way back to Vegas.

Came here last night with my friend because we were craving sushi and it was close to where we live. The food was good but the service...not so much. We walked in and the waitress asked how many and seated us at the bar, did not really smile at us or act friendly. I got a vibe that they were tired and wanted to go home. The next two people that walked in must of been regulars because the sushi chefs and waitresses immediately acknowledged them and said hello... Um, ok.

Anyhoo on the food...   I cannot complain about it,  it was really yummy. I got the Ninja box (teriyaki beef, shrimp/veggie tempura, spicy tuna roll (4 pieces) and some kind of dumpling?  Also came with salad and miso soup. My friend ordered the Jen 2 roll and the soft shell crab appetizer, she said both of them were good. 

Pro's - Food was great, restaurant is small and cozy, large sushi bar space to eat (hate rubbing elbows with my neighbor)

Con's - Bitchy waitstaff, never asked us if we wanted a refill on our drinks even though they charged us almost $3 for a coke, the prices on the sushi rolls here are pretty expensive and they don't have AYCE, booo.
This place is awesome! It's a little pricey compared to other sushi places around town. But nonetheless it's delicious!

Great service & great sushi. Everyone was very happy & friendly. Nikki was our waitress she was very fast and made us feel welcome. Overall me & my boyfriend were very pleased. Definitely will be coming back (:

Intimate atmosphere & friendly staff. More than just sushi on the menu... rice bowls, chicken teriyaki,  gyoza, etc. I was hoping for more traditional sushi choices, so it was hard to find rolls without cream cheese and crazy sauces. But they have creative specials & would be good for more adventurous sushi lovers. I got a tekka maki roll (tuna), sake (salmon on a ball of rice), & miso soup. Yummy sushi,  but I'm going to keep looking for somewhere more authentic.
Awesome spot for lunch. They have a bento special or a sushi special. Cheap and fast!

Great place.  Have both ate in and ordered out.  Always do great job on food.  It is a little more than a few other sushi places, but keep going back cause worth the few extra bucks.  Always get the Triple A Roll and edamame.
really good... very reasonable prices... service was kind of all over the place though... but great food!

I don't know what happened to this place it used to be my favorite sushi place for a long a time, came for dinner last night and the food was not good at all, the service was horrible. Our waitress took my order wrong, I was served a roll I did not order and when I called the waitress to let her know I was served something I did not order she literally started arguing with me saying that's the roll I had ordered, she then turns around says something to one of the sushi chefs in their language and they all start laughing it was actually very rude! I WILL NOT COME BACK again, the food I wouldn't mind giving it another shot since I know how good their food can be but the way I was treated and the service provided is completely unacceptable.

I'm actually pretty surprised this place has 4 stars. let me start off by saying I did go close to closing so that might have had a part into my bad experience. anyways, I went there probably a week ago and the sushi was just alright, nothing special.  Soft shell crab was no bueno.

went in and sat at the bar the sushi chef let me know as soon i sat down it would be a couple of minutes before he could start my order. . . . .. i had about 3 generous servings of handrolls. . . . great service, my water was always filled, the staff was extremely nice.  would recommend if your by sunset station
I hardly ever leave a review, or give 1 star. But the food was Really bad! Quality sucked, service sucked, prices were high.

The lunch special is such a good deal. It seems like the portion is so small, however, it really does fill you up. The salad and miso soup on the side was very tasty. I ordered the beef teryaki and it was very chewy. In addition to the food being great, the servers were very kind and welcoming. The atmosphere of the place is clean and petite as well. They also have a sushi bar area. Other than that, i enjoyed lunch. I look forward to trying their other dishes. Oh, they also serve free ice cream when you check in on Yelp! So don't forget to check in :)

Ahhh Momo...how I love thee.  This place has sentimental value to me (my boyfriend took me here on our first date, which happened to be Valentine's Day as well).  The sushi is really good, it's not a showy place like Kabuki, Sushi Roku, etc., and if you're an Uni person (like my bf), they don't always have Uni, but supposedly Uni is not always in season.  With that being said, I really do like Momo, you can't go wrong with any of their rolls and it is not expensive at all.  The sushi chefs are very funny and friendly too (if you sit at the bar, they will take a shot of sake with you). The Screaming Orgasm has got to be my favorite.  Oh and the sushi one isn't bad neither.

My first time eating sushi. Decided to come here after i read such good reviews. Let me tell you, this place is a must try place! I highly recommend this to everyone. The service is excellent! No complaints at all. Expect me to come here very often
Excellent sushi,  service and laid back feel.  Good cooks,  great unfiltered saki.  Small but nice.

I have yet to have bad service here. As a regular sometimes you expect an off night. So far, it's been amazing. The quality of sushi is great, the guys here won't serve anything they don't like. And have always been up front on what's fresh etc. 
   If you like Sashimi and you like it a bit spicy, then definitely try the Momo Hamachi appetizer. Its def one of my favorites. Perfectly sliced pieces of Hamachi, with a leaf of cilantro, and a thin slice of a jalapeno with a drop of sriracha...and Yuzu sauce  (kind of a citrucy flavor) And after enjoying this, I usually get the Kiss of fire roll, and ask if they Have Sake Kama ( salmon collar ).  
   Over all the atmosphere and staff are good. Its not overly loud, and the inside styling is like most pacific rim Japanese restaurants. 
   There are other great rolls and cooked fare as well. Just have a look at their menu.

http://www.momosushilasvegas.com/home.html
The sushi was some of the best I've had in town, however the service was AWFUL. Also, they do not have AYCE, but that doesn't affect my review.

The sushi rolls were very good. We got some rolls and a bento box. The bento box was huge but the chicken that we ordered was very dry and had no flavor. Besides the sushi which is always good I wouldn't order the teriyaki chicken again.

Went here because it was one of the few stores still open at 10 p.m. I got the Ninja box for about $15-16 which was not TOO pricy for a bento box dinner set. The set came with 3 pieces of shumai, a california roll (4 pieces?), salmon, vegetable and shrimp tempura, rice, and miso soup. The quality of everything was good, but nothing really stood out to me. I probably wouldn't go back since I have discovered some other pretty good sushi places which are either slightly comparable in price or even a little cheaper. If you are craving for sushi and are around the area, I'd say give it a try.

A friend and I went here for my birthday and I have to say I was impressed! Upon entering, I was a little surprised by the size of the place, it's small...VERY small, but they made up for the size in a BIG way with outstanding sushi and fantastic service. We especially enjoyed the Salmon Kama (Broiled Salmon Collar) and sake as we look over the menu and ultimately decided to let the chef do his magic  for us. Every roll was delicious, delicate and filled with flavor. At the end of the meal I was treated (on the house) to green tea ice cream and the entire place (which was full) sang happy birthday to me! Well worth going to!!

This place was pretty good. I have had better sushi at other places though, but this location is very close to my house so I come here once in awhile to take care of any sushi cravings. The terrikai chicken bowl was pretty good too!

Momo Yama Roll, Mexico City, Screaming Orgasim & Marc's Roll are my top pics at the time being. Johnny, the owner is hilarious and always willing to have some sake if you sit at the bar. :-) Clean establishment with a fun crowd and great staff.

Came here when my friend and I finished shopping at nordstorm rack. It was our first time in momoyama, our first thought was "its gonna be japanese fast food" coz it did look like one. However, when we got in we were amazed. The inside was actually pretty. Prices were inexpensive, rolls were around 7 - 12 dollars. We got three rolls and 2 appetizers, the appetizers were SMALL. However, the specialty rolls were all good. I highly recommend coming to momoyama after your day at galleria mall or nordstorm rack!

Now I am a fan of your specialty rolls and I will be back soon!

This is my husband and I's FAVORITE sushi place by far. They have so many options, sauces, etcetera. Their fish is always so fresh and delicious! The waitresses' are so attentive and have amazing customer service. I HIGHLY recommend this place, I wish I could give it 100 stars.

I really like this little place. It is hidden away in the retail hell of Stephanie Street down by the Sunset Station, but it is worth finding. Hit them on either Friday or over the weekend. I have been told that they get their fresh fish order on Friday and they tend to run out of some items as the week goes on. The Sushi is good and presented well with style and subdued beauty. They do not hide the flavor of their sushi with too much sauce, but instead rely on the quality of their fish and their work. They are quick and efficient. They have always been quick and efficient every visit I have made. My drink is never empty and a dirty dish does not sit on the table long.

They don't have an all you can eat so going on a sushi binge can get pricey. However, they do have a specials board behind the bar. I strongly urge you to take advantage of the specials as I have never been disappointed by them. They usually have a halibut sushi on the specials list that I simply love. Be brave when ordering because they have some pretty unique creations. Food courage is the most rewarding courage of all. 

I sadly can't give them five stars because their was a sushi place I went to all the time in North Carolina which IMO is the best sushi I have ever had. It has simply ruined me and all other sushi I eat I compare to that place. Sadly, nothing has ever lived up to their quality, but Momo comes pretty darn close. I wouldn't say it's worth a trip across town, but if you are in the southeast of Vegas for any reason over the weekend, this is must. And tell Momo I said hi...
(I don't know who the hell Momo is or even if there is a Momo, but a dare you to walk in and say "Doc says to tell Momo hi.")

This place is on point for the food, service and design. The food was amazing!!! I had 8 different rolls and all of them were amazing! They were very friendly and were very attentive even when the whole place was slammed. I was very very impressed with the hospitality and food. I would definitely recommend the place to come and eat.

Best sushi in Vegas! I love coming here- great atmosphere!

The Irish roll is the best roll ever!

Eric and the friendly staff were amazing!! Very good portions and incredible taste!! Great atmosphere and decor as well :) I had the Alaska roll and order of baked muscles and I enjoyed every bite! Go check out Momo!!

I agree with Micheal H who said "consistently awesome sushi" and C.J. who wrote "it's not a showy place like Sushi Roku..etc." I don't eat bento boxes, so I would take other Yelper's word on those. But as far as sushi goes, it's my favorite place in this area. I've been a regular here for since 2005.

I always order the Momo Yellowtail Sashimi special. At $12-14 it's not that great of a deal but they serve it with more fish than other places; the yellowtail is cut perfectly and covered with the right amount of citrus sauce, jalapeno and cilantro. Sen of Japan adds a crispy topping to this dish that I like, but they charge a little more too.

All other rolls are great. The Rebecca used to be a favorite. I also like the Irish Roll.

Service can be a little slow when they're busy but the wait staff are very nice and work hard.

I dropped  $200 a week for 4 months , and they had the balls to charge me .50 cents for ponzu sauce & .50 cents for sriracha sauce , why not just install a coin operated bathroom , 10 cents a napkin . I liked the place  5 minute walk from my house , Taylor was fantastic . A customer is  essential , why loose one ,( back to my favorite ) " THE SUSHI "
Worker there highly recommended Momo Sushi.  Tasty and fresh sushi. Service was great n friendly. Price was reasonable.

A whole menu of creative and interesting sushi rolls. And alot of them have pictures, and pictures are always good. I had the Judy roll and the Irish roll for lunch yesterday. I cant remember what was in them, but they were both good. I just randomly picked them because I liked the names. Although, I cant figure out how they came up with the names...especially the Irish roll? It wasnt even green?  I'd go back...in fact I'm going to have to so I can ask more questions about the names...I need to get to the bottom of this.

Food and service are both mediocre.

Came here for lunch one day and ordered a bunch of stuff to share. The prices are high for this area, and the food didn't taste all that great. The quality of fish for the sushi is decent but generally not a good cut of fish. The hamachi was a bit stiff and stringy. We did get the Sushi boat to share and that thing was huge for $50. Our bill was pretty high and we didn't feel like we got a lot of food. 

The rolls were ok. Service was ok, pretty mediocre. 

I think I'd get the same quality if not better quality at an AYCE place down the street. Most likely not coming back.
great sushi, great alternative if you do not want to do AYCE
Food is delicious, price is very reasonable and service is speedy and great. Will definitely be back.

Well, it's official guys!  I can finally stop staying "there's no good Japanese places near me in Henderson!"  cause this place was damn good! haha. Now I don't know if my palate has changed (highly doubt that) but the spicy tuna was so damn good!  It had the perfect blend of flavors with the right amount of kick, if you know what I mean!  And if you want to go for a big bang, you can get it extra spicy! =D  

I ordered the salmon skin salad, Orion Roll and the Jesty Roll.

Salmon Skin Salad:  Mmmm...the skin was crispy!  And the dressing was good!  None of that soggy salmon skin crap you get at some places.  Highly recommended! =)  

Orion Roll:  Momo's edition of spicy tuna roll topped with albacore tuna and drizzled with a garlic sauce.  Very delicious!  Rice was perfect, not too mushy, and not too undercooked!  Yum!!  

Jesty Roll:  Salmon rolled in masago, rolled up in rice, topped with more salmon and a thinly sliced lemon!  Super good for that refreshing taste you sometimes crave! =)  

The only down side to this place is it is a bit pricey.  I was bit upset at first, but once that spicy tuna hit my taste buds, they were dancing with joy and the price didn't matter anymore! haha.  

Check it out guys! =)

Very delicious food! Consider to be authentic Japanese kind. We are vegas travelers just happen to be nearby, what a lucky find! I recommend crazy horse sushi, udon, fried tofu, their salad is also great with homemade dressing.

I have lived in Vegas for 6 years and I never found a sushi restaurant I loved until my friend Lucas brought me here. 

Ditch the low quality all you can eat sushi and come here if you want good and fresh quality fish. 

We sat at the bar and James and Eric was our sushi chef. Fantastic and great chefs and I love when they give recommendations. Complimentary cucumber salad was brought out along with the usual ginger and wasabi. 

What to order
Hamachi sashimi with a jalapeño and a hint of Siracha. Not too spicy and the right amount of citrus. 

Toro: By far my favorite nigiri - the fatty tuna belly. Most places don't have this and I didn't see it on the menu so just ask for it!

Uni shooter: Came in a martini glass. I'm a huge fan of uni. 

Spicy halibut: with a hint of siracha and green onion. 

Also here's a tip. Ask James for his "Happy Orange" dessert. *hint hint wink wink. It's actually quite clever. 

5 stars for service and food.
MOMO is the spot for some great sushi! Get the Irish role!! Anything you get, will be awesome!
Every time we go we're never disappointed.  The sushi chefs are always obliged to make off menu goodies depending on what we're in the mood.  Highly recommend it!
My Lord! I love Mono Sushi and now we have one here in Boulder City.

This is hands down my favorite sushi bar in Henderson. I've been coming here twice a month for the past year and it never disappoints. Johnny and Simon always take excellent care of my family at the sushi bar. Must try items are the momo kanpachi special, white tuna paradise, live shrimp and fresh spicy halibut.

This place is a-frickin-mazing! I had the momo kampachi, and it was probably the best sashimi I have ever had. Definitely give this place a 5 star! A hidden gem! Simon was my sushi chef and he was helpful with helping me order and was an exquisite chef! Thank you to him and all of the momo sushi staff!!

Love love love this place. Came here for a late lunch with my son, his girlfriend and my big brother. My son has been here before but a first for me. It's not my usual sushi place an it's a little far from where I live. But hey my son lives this place so what the heck. WOW I have to say I couldn't get enough. The rolls were amazing. I ate way to much but loved every bite. Everything was very fresh an spot on. Everything we had from the spicy edamame to the rolls an even the teriyaki chicken were sooo yummy. The prices were reasonable an the service was perfect. We sat at the sushi bar which I like as you just order what you want. I know Its a drive but I will definitely go back. I'm so glad my son suggested to go there.

My favorite sushi joint ever since they opened almost 3 years ago I think!  When I lived over there, I ate at Momo's at least once a week!  And for the regulars, we get VIP cards that take a percentage of each bill and give cash back off a future bill of your choice.  Johnny always gets the freshest fish in and the sushi chefs are always talking and joking with the customers.  Highly recommend it to all of my friends!

Amazing every single time. Last few times I've got the Irish Roll and found it was the most amazing sushi I've ever had. Chefs are personable and friendly. Best of Las Vegas nominees for sure in the sushi category. I'll be back, of course

Besides having great sushi (my favorite in Henderson,) what makes this place so enjoyable is the sushi chefs! I've been coming here for years, and it comes down to great food and awesome people. You can go anywhere and find good sushi, but it's something special when you can interact and have fun with the people working there. 

The pricing is fair, as I rarely spend more on sushi than I would at an AYCE joint. I love sitting at the sushi bar there and they always have some sort of weekend special. Live shrimp is always a favorite. 

Overall, it's just an awesome place to go and have a good time with good sushi. Nothing beats Momo's for sushi on a Friday night.

In Boulder City for the holidays and was looking for something other than chicken wings, burgers and fries (which I do enjoy) after 4 straight days of over indulgence. I was very hesitant to try a Sushi restaurant in a town where the culinary diversify historically (last 20+ yrs.) consisted of one Chinese food buffet (now closed) and two marginal Mexican restaurants. The hesitation quickly dissolved as I walked in and was greeted by the friendly young hostess/server and the sight of beautiful slabs of fish being sculpted by the obviously very experienced sushi chef behind the bar. The fish was fresh and the rolls were big, innovative and delicious. This place could hold its own anywhere and was a gift to find at perfect time while on vacation in BC!

Delicious food, the sushi was fresh and they have a great variety. Buy one get one free sake everyday (score) and they were so kind to our kids. They just loved how they create fun little scenes and animals out of veggies and plate them the sushi. So cute!! Highly recommend!

Went there as a farewell to Las Vegas,and had a few rolls as well as a cucumber salad. It was all very good. The place is a bit small so it can get loud and not much atmosphere although like I said the food was very good.  If I weren't moving out of state I would certainly go back and try some more.
Nice place. Like the atmosphere. Prices aren't bad and the food is real good... The sushi chef even has a sense of humor.

So yummy! Nice and quiet restaurant. The picture I have is of the Jesty roll, which is my favorite! The lemon slices add such a nice flavor to the soy paper salmon roll. The fish is always nice and fresh. They are very quick too. The waitresses can be a little too attentive, but I obviously can look past that. Definitely give this place a try

I have eaten at Momo Sushi twice now, both for lunch. It would have been three times but the last time I tried to go for dinner it was packed. Momo definitely does the trick when I am in the mood for a little bit of sushi. Unfortunately, that is rarely the case, because when it comes to delicious raw fish, I like to stuff my face like a fatty. This is why I tend to go for sushi places that offer all you can eat... 

On my first visit I wasn't super hungry and had plans for dinner later that evening, so I just stopped in for a snack. The sushi chefs were nice and the tuna nigiri had great texture and flavor. I did find service to be a little lacking, I had to ask the sushi chef to get a waitress to refill my water, and had a bit of a wait to get the check. 

On my second visit I was very hungry. I ended up ordering edemame, a roll, as well as tuna and scallop nigiri. The sushi chef convinced me to go with the live scallop which was delicious.. but I wish I had known in advance it was going to cost me three times the price of the regular scallops. 

Pros:
Large and interesting rolls to choose from
Friendly sushi chefs
Above average fish quality

Cons:
Can get pricey quick with no option for ACYE
Waitress service is slow and not attentive enough
On the small side

Since I live fairly close and am often in the area to run errands, there is a decent change I will go back to Momo Sushi at some point. Chances are I will drive a little farther and go someplace that offers more fishy bang for my buck though!

Sushi is ok and service is even worse. We came in on a Friday and it was super busy, I guess they can't handle busyness well. We waited 20 min just for the server to get our drink order and another 20 for her to come back and get our food order. They kept messing up our order and we couldn't wait to get out of there honestly. Only reason they have 2 stars is because some of their items on the menu are good but it's such a hit or miss. They need to learn how to cut fish pieces correctly. I got a roll with tuna on top and it was literally a fat CHUNK of tuna which was due to cutting too much not appetizing at all. They also did the same to my albacore sushi which is why I just ordered fried sushi or other appetizers.

Wasn't all you can eat but was the best sushi I've had. The service slack a little when we first sat down then got better. Might be our new to go place!! The quality of the food is so great compared to many places and so fresh! Even our daughter loved it!

I've been going to Momo's for years & never have had an issue. I ordered take out and ordered a screaming orgasm and when I got home, I mixed everything together and went to take a bite of the ahi tuna and found a bug in my food. I was horrified and called Momo's to tell them what had happened. They recommended that I come back to the restaurant to show them the video and to get a refund. I went back a couple hours later and the sushi chef and waitress apologized and told me it had nothing to do with the fish as it would have been more of a parasitic worm, as this was more of a plant bug. They informed me it was from the sprouts on top of the screaming orgasm that they had received from a vendor and that in the future they will be more cautious as to cleaning the sprouts more thoroughly and they had already contacted the vendor. 
They gave me a full refund and a gift card for the future. I have never had any problems with them previously and was very caught off guard when it happened.
I love their spicy crab and spicy tuna! It's always fresh and delicious! They are fast and really nice.
No all you can eat?? Way to compete with other places guys. At least we know where we shouldn't go
We are from out of town but the service and food was exceptional. We ordered a few of their rolls and some mussels and definitely some of the best rolls I've had in a long time!
Sushi was fresh but still not as good as Sushi Koma on corner of Flamingo and Durango.

This place has some of the most creative and tasty sushi rolls ever. Their staff is very welcoming and persistent. One of the best places for quick and delicious food. The not only have sushi available but a multitude of other yummy options!

This is one of the best sushi place in Henderson. They have so many variety of choices. The price is isn't as expensive even though they have such a great quality dishes. Also, great service! Five stars!

I think we tried some of the more non traditional rolls, which is why I am only giving 3 stars. The rolls are good and its closer to our house but its not the best sushi I've ever had. We tried the irish roll, palm tree roll, and volcano roll. The Irish roll is somewhat odd tasting because of the liquidy sauce on it. Just an odd taste so neither of us liked it. My wife liked the palm tree roll and I really liked the volcano roll. I would recommend it to friends and will go back and try a few more rolls because overall it was good, and theres a huge selection of rolls.

This was a good recommendation from a friend and Yelper - glad we stopped in. The food was delicious and fresh - the price is reasonable for sushi and the service was friendly and fast. We will definitely be back.

Terrible service. Understaffed or they just don't care. Was seated and didn't get any serviced or over 5 minutes. I just got up and left, who knows if they even noticed. Won't go back here again. Sad.

Perfect place for a lunch with the family. The boxes were delicious-- I ordered it with chicken teriyaki and beef teriyaki. The beef was ok but I enjoyed the salad and rice and soup. The California roll is pretty good too :) I would recommend this for any who enjoy Japanese food!

Best sushi place ever . I've tried so many sushi places none of them is better than Momo . Always fresh , great quality...and i would say the most things which i am really satisfied with is always fresh food and the rice and how they wrap the sushi roll  cause most of the other places you go the, rice is not good and when you try to eat that it falls apart easily, and you cannot enjoy it. Love Momo

My friend and I are always on a search for good sushi bars in Vegas and this is my personal favorite. And they have the best Screaming O' (orgasm) in town. Their food is always quality and their costumer service is pretty good. Fair warning, the low/no sodium and their regular soy sauce are the same.

Amazing spot in Boulder City with outdoor seating and a cozy intimate atmosphere inside. Delish Halibut with uni, screaming orgasm and nigiri combo special! Get an excellent bottle of Kurosawa sake for only $40! Steal! Lovely Erica took care of us. New favorite Local spot when visiting BC from Vegas for the day!

Walked in here on my lunch because I've seen some of co-workers go here. This place is not an AYCE restaurant just FYI. Food was great I order there salmon and tuna bento. Service was nice and welcoming. Definitely will be going here again.

This is my second time eating here. Today Megan was my server. Very sweet and prompt.  The food was excellent, fresh, well plated, fast service.  They understand food allergies and will work with you. The place is very clean. The prices are just a tad higher then the average.  Small places seats maybe 60. All in all a very nice small place to get a good quality meal.

My family and I have been coming here for years. Food, service and experience only get better with time. They keep serving sushi true to Japanese culture by not offering AYCE, so it's not the place for you if that's what you're looking for. If you sit at the bar be sure to ask for James!
This is my first time here, the eel and avocado roll was delicious !  Very friendly staff and nice and quiet ambience. Very nice to unwind and relax. Definitely coming back :)
The freshest sushi I have ever had. I come here often love the cherry blossom roll and I've tried about every roll here.

My husband and I agreed that this was the best sushi of our lives. And he would follow that up with also saying "and I've had a shit load of sushi"

Seriously - don't go to one of the many overpriced places in Vegas or one with all the deep fried cream cheese roll crap. Drive to Boulder City and eat here. Worth the price of a rental car

I love MoMo's and would give it 5 stars. 
The only thing that really bothers me is  the music is on w=a=y too loud!!
I'm not one to sit at a restaurant and have to scream to my friends for conversation. 
It's not very enjoyable. I mean who wants to have a meal and try to relax and enjoy
with loud blaring music going on. It would be nice if the music was at a nice quaint level and not blaring like your at a
Nite club!!

The new spot! Excellent sushi. Eric took care of our sushi entrees and they were delicious. One thing I really loved was how tight the rolls were. Usually I'll have a bunch of rice and ingredients piling up in my sauce bowl, and have to dump it out, but after all the rolls, all that was left was soy sauce with maybe 1-2 pieces of rice.  He even made us a personal chefs creation, which was different than the usual that we eat anywhere else but it was delicious! Great Sushi Chef!! (Pic added!) We also had dessert. At other sushi places, you might get one little scoop of ice-cream, but not at Momo Sushi, there was at LEAST 3 scoops in that bowl lol and I love ice cream, there's always room for dessert! Overall, we had a great experience and will definitely be going back, thankfully we live just around the corner! I definitely recommended it to anyone that wants to find a new place to go that is better than your usual! Thanks again Eric and Momo Sushi!

I always wondered about this sushi spot when I was eating at Babystacks or Genghis so yesterday I finally ventured in. The verdict? It's okay, not outstanding, but not bad either.

For Saturday at lunch we found the restaurant to be pretty empty and we were quickly seated at a booth. I started with Edamame that wasn't good, possibly even bad. It didn't seem fresh. My other starter was a Green Salad and I absolutely loved the ginger dressing on top. My husband and I shared three rolls. We ordered the Mexico City, Hawaiian, and Shrimp Tempura. My favorite was the Hawaiian, but overall we liked all three. 

The service was mediocre. The waitress was sweet, but she seemed very frazzled even though the restaurant wasn't busy. We had to order my husband's Sprite twice and it seemed like she thought it was a new order instead of something she forgot about. After all the food arrived sans salad I had to ask for my salad a second time. She was about to take our order and ran away mid-sentence before returning to take our order. Other tables were walking back to the kitchen to ask for forgotten items too. I kind of felt bad for her because she seemed totally out of it. Maybe it was just an off day. 

Overall, the rolls were decent, but the service left a little to be desired.

The food is good, the service was passable. The first time we went, I asked for a substitution for one of the items in a dinner bento box (sesame chicken instead of teriyaki chicken). The second time I went, I asked for the same substitution, and was denied the request. Not sure why, they did not give a coherent explanation.

Prices are pretty standard compared to other Japanese establishments. It never seems to be too busy and they stay open fairly late compared to other places in Henderson.
Whenever I am in the mood for Sushi in Boulder City or Henderson, I always go to Momo Sushi! Great people and great food!
The sushi is the best I had in Vegas. It's delicious and always fresh! Also try the spicy edamame. It's amazing! The service is great too - always very friendly.

Just tried this place today, and it's my first time trying the sushi in Las Vegas. Thus far it is the worst sushi I ate in the U.S. And considering the reviews on this place, I'm hesitant to try sushi anywhere else in Vegas if this place is considered good.
The fish is not cut right or to the correct size, it's definitely not fresh, and all together it tastes poor. 
Today's was my first and last time at this place.
I love this place! good customer service and good food. It's my go to sushi spot!

Finally found an authentic sushi place in Henderson area. Must try the Salmon Skin Hand Roll. Very crispy and generous serving of vegetables! Also if you like squid sushi, Creative Chef designed it an actual squid AND it has mint leaf the way it should! Everything was delicious - for Sushi lovers! Thank you Momo Sushi !!!!!
I took my Mom here today for lunch and was impressed with the Ahi tuna poki, while my Mom went fir the rolls. We'll be back for dinner soon! The prices are very reasonable.

It was just decent. The sushi lunch came with 6 pieces of Nigiri, and a roll of your choice from a short list (I hit the smoked salmon roll). The nigiri was a little mangled, but the roll was good. It was good enough that I would return, but I'll look hard for a better place that's nearby

Nice little place with a warm atmosphere.  Good menu with many traditional Japanese items.  Terrific friendly and fast service.  We will be back - in fact it may be one of our new favorites.  My sweetheart had the teriyaki salmon dinner - which was tender and bursting with flavor.  I had the California rolls and spicey tuna rolls with an avacado salad - the rolls are best I've had yet since moving to Las Vegas in 1990.  Parking is no problem either.  Truly a welcoming addition to the Boulder city area.  Highly recommend for a quality casual sushi dining experience that wont break the bank!
Service was and always is great. Andrew was my server and he was super attentive and awesome. I live down the street and this place may be a weekly stop for me

We stumbled upon this place later one night when the original place we wanted to go was closed. I am so glad we found it. A great meal for an even better value. O got the Momo box which I couldn't even finish because it came with so much food and my boyfriend got two huge fresh rolls and finished my box. The servers were friendly and helpful. The club music and young atmosphere was incredibly relaxing for two college kids in T-shirt's. Can't wait to come back.
I love this place!!! Delicious food and great service!!! Yay momo!!!
This place is awesome! The sushi is great the staff is really fun. One of the cooks even made me a special sushi roll because I wasn't sure what to get. I highly recommend to come here.
Our favorite place for sushi in Las Vegas.  Everything we have ordered here is excellent and fresh!  Clean and great service.  Go there immediately!
I ordered the Henry roll and a California roll. Both super fresh and tasty! Service at the sushi bar was awesome, and the ambiance was lovely.

This place is literally right across the street from Chinook. Took one look at the line at Globefish and drove out, turned left and was seated with a hot tea. Staff was very friendly and quick. Reading some other reviews I thought it would be pricey, but I thought the opposite. Generous size portions for sashimi, 15 pcs for $17.95. I would say that's cheaper than the handful I usually dine at. I was thoroughly impressed with the tempura and agedashi tofu as well. The batter is done light and there's a good variety of vegetables and 4 shrimp. I was getting really tired of eating batter that tastes like old gross oil from some other places.

Someone also mentioned that they have just the average Japanese menu.
Which is true, because they are a Japanese restaurant. Not a Japanese fusion - put random ingredients in a roll- restaurant. They do have some popular rolls like the BC roll, Alaska roll etc.

Momo sushi keeps the heart of Japanese fare genuine- simple and very well done.

Plus points for the ginormous tea pot they keep refilling, even without asking.
Plus even more points because I will admit I have eaten here before when they first opened. It wasn't even 4 stars. But it looks like they have made leaps and bounds and improved based on critique and feedback from customers.
That earns my respect and patronage.

Review #10 of Yelp's 30 Day Challenge 2012

Probably the worst service we've ever experienced. 

We were a party of 4 (myself, my wife, our 3 year-old and 6 month old). We ordered water and they only brought 2 of the three we asked for (nothing resembling a kid's cup) we eventually got another water when we ordered our food but it set the tone for the rest of the evening. 

Food arrived relatively quickly and was average sushi, nothing remarkable. We ordered udon with chicken and the waitress though the best place to put it was directly in front of our 6 month-old. Before we could even react he grabbed the plate the bowl was on and pulled it, causing extremely hot udon to splash out onto his hand. Just about every other customer saw or heard what happened and audibly reacted, some even asked what they could do, not one single employee even bothered to see if there was anything they could do. As parents we understand and accept it is ultimately our responsibility to keep our kids from harm but who in their right mind would put steaming hot soup in front of a 6 month old...?

Our last roll was brought out about 5 minutes later and that was the last time we saw our waitress until we stopped her and asked for a container for the remaining udon. That was also the only time our water was refilled, after our food was gone and we were waiting for them to bring our bill. 

When we arrived it was not very busy, by the time we received our food the dinning area had filled up  but there was never more than 1 group waiting to be seated. Had they been swamped with customers I would better understand the lack of service but there was no obvious explanation. 

Needless to say we won't be returning; average food at best and even if the food had been exceptional the quality of service would keep us away.

Very disappointing to say the least! We had a friend in town visiting and thought we would give Momo's a try. So very sorry we did! The tuna was puréed and we didn't like the taste or consistency of gobo. Would not go back.
The food here is amazing! The staff is friendly and provide excellent service. It's a very clean and fun environment. Highly recommend this place for sushi and Japanese cuisine.

St. Patty's dinner with my honey and I was inspired to order the "Screaming Honey" lol. Glad I did bc it's freakin' amazing!!!! The price for one order of it is about $8 (rounded off) but I ended up ordering two just for myself. Yes, it was that good!!! And on top of the great food, the service was beyond my expectations. I've lost interest in dining in here after I noticed that one of my favorite servers was no longer at this restaurant, but I'm happy to say that our server tonight, Nickie, has changed that.
My wife and I enjoy his place regularly. We are super excited they are coming to Boulder City!

Is it amazing? No. So far, we haven't found an amazing, 5 star worthy, sushi restaurant in Vegas/Henderson. :(. BUT its second to I Love Sushi, and a close second at that.  The location is great, and it is our go-to spot when we're craving sushi. It is a solid place to get your Japanese food fix. It won't wow you, but it won't disappoint either. I recommend the crispy spicy tuna--- it's REALLY really good. You can find it on the "special" menu. :)

Not too bad, it's no Kaizen, but it's ok. 
Location is good for me. But the restaurant is a little outdated but the service is very mediocre

I've been here twice with my boyfriend and it's been great each time. The ugly roll is my favorite, along with one of the fruity sakes. The service in the dinning room is ok, but its nicer to sit at the sushi bar to watch the Chef prepare the rolls or ask for something they might not have on the menu .

You can't compare this restaurant to an all you can eat sushi spot.. 
The Chefs are super nice! The food is delicious!!! And the service is great! 
We love the 2 for 1 sake most of all though!

There just aren't enough good things to say about this place!  The service is AMAZING.  Everybody is so friendly, and Chef B especially makes visiting Momo a welcome and entertaining experience each and every time.  

The food has never disappointed.  We've probably tried everything on the menu at least once, but our absolute favorite top two things to order are the Henry Roll and the Ugly Roll.  Sometimes, when we don't know what we want, B takes over and just creates something for us on the fly.. he's truly a very talented and detail oriented chef!!!

Sometimes we'll visit other sushi places, but we always regret we didn't just go to Momo Sushi instead.  It's as good as it gets in our book!

Tried this place for the first time and we really enjoyed it. This place does not have all you can eat so if that's what you're looking for don't bother. Their sushi selection is really good and so was the service. I would definitely return.

I wanted to find something close to home and last time I had momo I enjoyed it so I decided to come back tonight. The boyfriend and I ordered 10 pieces of gyoza [he's in love with gyoza, if the restaurant has it on the menu, he's automatically ordering it]. Gyoza was alright, I would give it a 4/5. We also ordered kalbi which came with rice and miso soup and priced at $15. Kind of pricey but it was cooked quite well. Very flavorful and came on a sizzling plate like at typical Korean restaurants. For sushi we ordered salmon, kanpachi, uni, and the hooter's roll. The fresh wasabi they put on the fish has a kick to it so be careful with that. Salmon was good, but you can't usually go wrong with salmon unless it's too fishy smelling. I was a bit disappointed in their kanpachi. I usually love kanpachi but it was sliced quite thin so I could barely taste it. The uni here is always good!! I'd definitely recommend it. And the hooter's roll was like the cucumber protein roll but with radish instead of cucumber wrapped around it. It was refreshing but I think I prefer cucumber instead of radish. Overall, I'd go again and I'd recommend this place for sushi if you wanted something around this area.

We went into Momo about 8:30pm on New Years Eve and it was very quiet. Sat at the sushi bar and the chefs were ready to help. They have a big sushi menu and dinner menu. First off, don't worry about them NOT having AYCE because the rolls you get are huge.  The fish was very fresh and tasty. The service is very attentive and everyone is very friendly. This is one of the better sushi places in Vegas. Glad we stopped in in a whim.

You get a lot of food for the price. We especially enjoyed the lunch special where you get to pick two entrees to go with soup, salad, and gyoza and rice. 
  I liked the salmon teriyaki, and the chicken katsu was pretty crispy. Ginger salad was good too.
   My six year old said that the food was really yummy. The children's box is the same price as the lunch special. I would pick the lunch special since you get more selection.
   My only complaint was that the hot water in the woman's bathroom is scalding.  My 6 year old burned 2 of her fingers washing her hands. So  if you are bringing children to the bathroom, you need to regulate the water. We did tell the waitress and hopefully they will turn the water down.
 Overall, we will eat here again. I agree with Sunny D's review- sushi is right up there and the prices are reasonable only at lunch time.

We ordered take out for dinner, and the dinner menu prices were overpriced. I would eat here only for lunch. When we ordered take out, they forgot one menu item and we had to drive back and get the rest of the order.

Had a fantastic dinner with my friend. I ordered the sushi dinner for $20. The sushi was very fresh. I had the Alaskan sushi specialty roll and my friend had the tomato roll which tasted very good and was low carb with rice. Definitely a healthy option. Great ambiance and close to the house. Will definitely be back.

This place has an excellent selection. Their rolls are all reasonably priced. This was a perfect lunch meal. 3 rolls and a seaweed salad for under $30. They do not do All you can eat here but I think thats a good thing. Their quality is much higher as a result. The place itself is sort of hidden off the west side of Stephanie in a small strip mall. Definitely check this place out if you are a Sushi coniseur.

I don't know where people are getting bad service, but it's not here. There was a large party, several families, and a bar full of people - and we still got super service. We ordered several rolls to share, and they came out as made, one at a time - and quick! Loved the Irish roll (but then, I would, huh?) The Orion roll was delightfully spicy and flavorful. The Rock-n-Roll did, in fact, rock. Hot tea got immediate refills without asking. Prices were mid-range. Sake prices were too high to bother with, though.

Clean, small, close to home, and yummy (and since Yummy shut down, we've been looking for another...)

My only complaint is that the music seriously bites. Bad rap-fusion-80's asian-not-sure-what-but-it's-bad. Just bad.

Music bad. Food good.

Sitting here at the bar as I write my review, I am glad they haven't changed anything about this place. It is NOT all you can eat but their rolls are BIG so if you are a NORMAL person, with a NORMAL stomach you will be good with 2 rolls which amounts to all you can eat anyway. Usually all the "all you can eat" places have tiny rolls. The employees are very nice, and on top of everything. I finished my cucumber salad and the sushi chef asked me if I wanted more. I took a long time looking at the menu and was asked like 2 times if I was ready to order. I will definitely be back again and again. This time I ordered the Triple A roll and a standard California roll. Delicious! I have also had their Volcano roll in the past and the Jennifer 2. I recommend all!
Yet again another amazing experience for dinner with the family! Food is always delicious, service is pretty quick. Always accommodating! Love this place!

When I was in San Francisco 2 weeks ago, I drove all the way to try the best chinese chicken wings at San Tung.  I wasn't too impressed because I ordered the dry ones and got the wet wings.... However, out of this Barry F messaged me to try it again and stated that when he comes to Henderson, he loves MOMO Sushi so he was surprised I did not review it...

I took the opportunity to check this out over the weekend and I loved it.  Thanks Barry.

The environment - Cozy, soft lighting, nice sushi bar, the place is just right to me. It seems that it was perfectly suited to be a sushi restaurant. It just works right!

The service - A bit homey and homestyle, so you get both caring people who can be a bit slow at times.  Hey, you know what, that is okay with me because it feels like family.

The Sushi - This is where the place excels.  Had several orders of  Uni, Amai Ebi, Maguro, Tai, Hamachi, It was all so very good.  Large nice pieces of fish and very flavorful. You should be aware that they do use the wasabi on the sushi between the rice and the fish, so if you don't want it, you should tell them.  I enjoy it but my son prefers to not have wasabi.  I was not happy that they did not have the Toro that was on the menu and the Kai as they were out.  I also ordered Mirugai and they were out of this too.  Boo hoo.  I would have marked them a 4 star for the food but what they did have was awesome.  I have to give kudos to the Amai Ebi.  The fried shrimp head was so plump and so delicious.  I wonder if they somehow stuffed the them heads with something way deliciouso???  We also had some seriously large rolls like Tiger, Dragon, and a few others.  All were good and tasty, just that I am not a huge Roll person.

The price - For about 4-5 rolls and all the nigiri sushi, we spent about 100.00 so while for the three of us it was more expensive than an AYCE place, the quality was amazing.

GK says, check it out...

This is my go to take-out sushi place when I want to eat at home. Their sushi is always fresh and prepared pretty quickly. On a busy Friday night it takes about 15-20 minutes for the order. My favorite roll there is their Irish roll. It has a ton of flavor. Every other roll I've tried has been delicious as well.
One of the best Japanese meals I've had in town, and my husband was pleased at how quickly we got served. I had the Momo box-- excellent tempura! Will definitely be back!

Lunch specials and dinner boxes are great deals!  Its not an AYCE sushi place but they have great tasting nigiri and sushi.  I ordered and the Sushi Dinner Box and ordered the Stuffed Tomato Roll (great for you salmon lovers out there.  Salmon sashimi wrapped around spicy crab, greens, and topped ponzu sauce).  6 chef picked pieces of nigiri and miso soup were also included.  Food prep was quick and staff was nice.

Found hair in my food and they didn't apologize or discount the meal... they just looked at me & said thats not hair... but then after examining it closer they said yeah its hair then took the plate. Unsanitary! No customer service!

Welcoming staff in an inviting location.  Cold house Saki was good. Loads of "Specialty Rolls" selections BUT no Nigri... not acceptable!  Flavors were very good with proper spice of the rolls we chose ... prices were reasonable.

The momos on Stephanie is my friends and I'd go-to for sushi. The sushi is amazing every time and I've been there many many times. James is our guy!! He always does an amazing and quick job behind the counter. He also turns fruits into animals or characters haha!

I've only been here once but I had a great experience!  My friend and I came and ordered the nigiri special with one roll, and another roll a la carte. The rolls were good. Standard good rolls from a sushi restaurant but nothing spectacular.  

What blew my socks off was the nigiri!  It was so fresh and delicious!  In vegas you have a lot of all you can eat sushi so the nigiri you get there is kind of ehhhh.... Either too much rice, or the fish is not fresh.... Or something about it is just off.  But this is not an all you can eat sushi place. The quality was very good. The coloring, the butteriness of the fish, the soft texture, everything was on point. Nigiri special changes daily as its up to the chefs choice. 

I don't eat in Henderson often by im glad I came here.  They also have great beer on draft and happy hour as well!

Used to go there every other week. Last time, was last.  Awful waitress, she didn't understand anything, got our order totally wrong. It was Saturday night, we sat at the sushi bar, but no fresh live seafood. We order from the kitchen, same, could get anything we were ordering.  Too bad, I used to love that place.

I am not hard to please and try to give benefit of the doubt more than I should but I have been disappointed on the service here on more than one occasion recently. I've been coming here for many years and the food has always been great but service is hit & miss.  Today I called in a order for 2 simple items, a Screaming O with extra sauce and a Jackpot Roll.  When I arrive, there were only 2 people dining so it wasn't busy, I pay for food and check my bag for the extra sauce I asked for.  My ticket had it on there but there was just the standard cup that always comes with the Screaming O.  I tell the waitress that I am missing it and she proceeds to tell me that the cup in there is extra.  Mind you I have been ordering this from there to go for over 10 years. Then the other waitress ask is everything ok and I show and tell her that it wasn't extra sauce and she says "sorry", I just stand there in shock that she is not getting my extra sauce but just looking at me. I then tell her that the service is not good and it clearly says extra sauce.  She them says you will have to pay extra for it.  I am baffled!!!! The ticket says extra sauce, you should have already charged me if there was a charge, how does it say it and you don't give it and yet have the nerve to tell me to pay more.  I just grabbed by bag and walked out.  I am sure the management will not respond or attempt to satisfy my lack of decent service. They will be loosing a longtime customer that spends and tips generously there.  Mind you I tipped the waitresses despite my frustration with them.  Step up your game Momo Sushi. There are many other choices around!!!

To end a day full of shopping with my friend, we decided to get one of my favorite meals: sushi! I'm always open to trying new sushi joints, especially if it's super close to my house! The shopping really built up an appetite for me so I was definitely looking forward to this visit. 

This restaurant in the same building as Genghis Grill and the new Baby Stacks restaurants. When you walk into the location, you will notice a couple of things: it's dark and crowded! The waiting area was very small, but once you pass that, you see the sushi bar to the left, for sure a focal point as it's practically the only lit area in the restaurant. To the right was the dining area. Here's what I can say: it's crowded with tables and unnecessary decor. antlers on the walls, fake plants and vines are really outdated and don't really fit the restaurant's personality. The booths had low hanging dim lights and ours was covered in dust. Definitely needs a spring cleaning in there! Our server's name was Megun and she was definitely one with a lot of personality! I was wearing a sriracha shirt, which she noticed and started a conversation from. I really appreciated her attentiveness throughout our meal. 

For our late lunch, I wanted to get a hamachi kama. The problem was they ran out of it, so I had to choose something else. Darn! I ended up getting 4 orders of the Hamachi Nigiri for $4.50 an order (2 pieces per order) and 2 orders of the tako for $4.25 per order. One thing that threw me off about this place was the fact that they didn't offer the All You Can Eat option. That meant my meal was going to be pricey for not a lot of stuff. For the food, I thought it was just alright. The hamachi was pink in color, pinker than I'm used to. Made me think if that was super fresh or just a different part of the fish. It was good though. What I did not like, however, was the fact that they put wasabi between the rice and fish. That was new and a complete surprise as it stung my nose! LOL. Be advised, you do not need wasabi in your soy sauce.  There's already wasabi in the sushi, and lots of it! The tako (octopus) was the same with the wasabi. I thought the flavor and texture was consistent with what I often times get, so no surprises there, it was very good. 

For me, this was hard. When I go to restaurants looking for sushi, I'm looking to get a lot of it. To pay the same amount as I would for an All You Can Eat meal at another restaurant, I really didn't get a lot of food. I wouldn't mind coming back and trying something else, but if it's sushi, I would probably opt to go to a sushi joint with an AYCE option. Thanks Momo, though, for the experience. I appreciate it!

Was looking for good sushi so Google Searched some places and this is where intended up.  Great friendly quick service and selection. The sushi was really good and prices were fair!  I'll definitely be back!

Once again Momo delivers! Momo Sushi has become our must go to place when we're visiting from California. The ambiance and the food are unmarked we are yet to find a place in California that matches this package. I would and have highly recommended this place to friends and acquaintances.

Even tho we don't get to go here as often as I'd like, I still consider Momo Sushi one of the better sushi restaurants in Henderson. The quality of of the food plus the attentive & friendly service makes for a great dining experience every time we go. 
During our most recent visit back at the end of February, they finally had the live shrimp that we had wanted to try on our 1st visit so we got an order of that. Although I didn't know exactly what was involved in the preparation of the shrimp, the end product was delicious!

We love this place.   We've taken a few people here and it is unanimous that the sushi is freshest and best anyone has ever had.  Sit at the sushi bar,  be honest with the sushi chefs, and trust them in making something a little bit more unique for you (if you're not on a super tight budget).  If you're a little bit more careful, the sushi rolls are very filling and very delicious....but the sushi bar experience really is amazing.

I go to Momo Sushi about once a month, and I have never left disappointed. 

On my most recent visit, for my wedding anniversary, my wife and I shared a couple of rolls, and the Momo Box, which includes teriyaki chicken, rice, 4 sushi rolls, and a few other samples. We spent under $40 on this visit. Not $40 each, but $40 total. I find the prices here to be more than reasonable, especially considering how good the food is. 

I've brought several friends here, some of whom could be called sushi snobs, and I've heard nothing but praise for the quality and taste of food served here.
