The location on Stephanie puts Momo Sushi a quick drive from most of Henderson, and a great alternative to eating at the mall when spending an afternoon there. The ambiance is inviting, and the servers are always friendly.

Be sure to check in on Yelp to get a free dessert!

Kat and I often get sushi cravings that lead us into trouble; case in point, last weekend we had a date and when deliberating about what to eat, we only needed to give each other a sly look and nod. SUSHI! So we decided to try out this place across Chinook Center; we haven't been before, and Angelo T. recommended it as decent.

We were struck by the charming intimacy, and as soon as we started rattling off our demands, we realized we might need a bigger table. We got takoyaki and gyoza to start, and both were as good as we've ever had. We then ordered the smoked salmon and dynamite rolls, along with the standard California rolls, and to top it off, Kat got a teriyaki beef rice bowl, and I got a dinner box with 5 pieces of sashimi, teriyaki pork and tuna rolls. Immediate regrets! Our table happily groaned with the weight, and we ate as diligently as we could; needless to say, Kat's bowl was untouched and came home with us.

The food was delicious; I don't normally get sashimi, but the pieces were fresh and texturally sound. The teriyaki had an interesting sweet undertone, almost as if cinnamon was present. I think perhaps a smaller order would have worked better to give all the items their chance to shine. The service was good and enthusiastic, and I would recommend Momo as a good place to satisfy a sushi craving.

High quality, very well prepared and above average quantity.   Price is right.  I think this worthy.  One skinny waitress was awesome.  Very friendly.
I am making this a regular place for me.

Stumbled upon this place while out shopping and decided to give it a shot.

The interior was very nice, dim with comfortable booths and tables. The booth seats were a little worn but that's OK.

They had quite a good variety of rolls and very reasonably priced. Everything was fresh, tasty and the service was super friendly. We had two specialty rolls, a basic roll and two beers for just $40. We also had a free dessert with the Yelp check in. The green tea ice cream was a perfect finish. 

This may be my new go-to local place.
I just love everything here! Their yum yum scallop hand roll is my favorite here compared to any other place in town..they know how to get down on rolls and just everything tastes good..

Been here quite a few times now and decided to write a review for the awesome service and response from Andrew and Megan. The chirashi bowl was very good quality, and it is just amazing find here in Henderson !

First time here. Great food! Awesome service too! 
Thank you Meghan for being so nice and always checking on our table.
I never realy cared for sushi until I visited this place. My favorite is the Ugly Roll with yum yum sauce. The employees are great too.

First must say the sushi is AMAZING ...
Secondly the Staff is friendly and very attentive ! I recommend this place to anyone who knows what fresh fish is ! I love the tuna karai!!!
The sushi and fried dumplings were both so good!! Highly recommend the SS Roll! Our waitress was very friendly and welcoming.

The sushi was delicious. The Jennifer 2 was extremely good. I ordered 2 rolls. The only downfall was the service. The waitress forgot to put our order in so we waited a very long time for our rolls, but she apologized and gave us some edamame on the house. We sat at a table, but we'll most likely sit at the bar the next time we visit.
One of my go to lunch places. Good customer service. Great selection and portion size of the bentos. Nigiris have good rice to seafood ratio..

Momo Sushi is my go-to spot for dinner when I'm in Boulder. In a small town like Boulder City, vegan options are a rare commodity indeed. However, vegans can usually DIY something at Japanese restaurants (think edamame, veggie tempura, tofu, etc.). Momo Sushi is nice enough that they accommodate my off the menu requests. I order tofu with steamed veggies topped with teriyaki sauce. If I'm extra hungry. I'll order a side of rice ($2). My DIY meal is actually under $10, so it's super affordable. There's also a veggie roll on the menu that I'm definitely ordering on my next visit. 

I've been to Momo's with my husband and friends, and everyone wholeheartedly gives their approval. It's a cozy little restaurant with super reasonable prices. In fact, on our last visit, our dinner came to $18.95! Gotta love that price tag.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2017: #6

Momo Sushi is your standard neighborhood restaurant, suitable for a quick eat after shopping. We had miso soup, tuna nigiri, some special spicy roll, and ice cream. 

Some noticeable traits: the lighting does not work well with the menus, as the glare makes the reading uncomfortable, and my ice cream was partially melted. Another interesting characteristic is that the fish on the nigiri seems lengthy compared to the rice. It's not hugging the mound of rice, like most, but instead trails off both ends. It doesn't mean anything, I suppose, it just looks different.
It's not all you can eat but not better ten a lot of the all you can eat place I've been to. Get more bang for your buck and go to another all you can eat.

momo's is small and cozy... it's a family owned place and so gracious!  i love sushi chef james... he makes me specialities not on the menu.  : )  affordable, fresh seafood and nice ppl.  cant go wrong.


no all you can eat sushi here. but they do have 2 for 1 house sake.

This sushi restaurant is one of the best you'll find in Henderson! Top notch rolls, excellent presentation and their lunch and dinner specials are unbelievable! I've been coming here for as long as I can remember and will never stop!

I've been coming here for years. Since the previous owners. The service is sometimes a little lacking, but the sushi is absolutely incredible EVERY SINGLE TIME. So the good makes us for when the service isn't that great. My favorite place. I always end up coming back here! And two for the price of one sake everyday?? Yes please!

Me and my family are big sushi eaters and this was the first time we ate at a Las Vegas sushi spot. We're from the bay area, California where there are some great sushi place and I must say, we did not like the sushi from here at all. We thought it was over priced for something so simple and it didn't even wow us. It was mediocre but we ate it because we were hungry. I recommend not to go here...please find some other sushi place. This place is not worth it. I hope not all sushi spots in LV are like this one.
The staff was talking to each other rather than serving the tables. Our order came wrong and one of the dishes came undercooked - cold in the middle
They place was ok a bit small and crowded but the food was good and great flavor, it was my first time here, staff is ok hard to understand their English.

I have been going to Momo Sushi for 11 years, ever since they first opened. I have tried everything on the menu! I love the rolls, and all the different sauces they make. I enjoy going to Momo and always have a great time, talking to John the owner, and if you sit at the Sushi bar, you can have a lot of fun with the chefs, buy them a sake or a beer if you can, they really appreciate it! Make sure you check out Momo, it is a locals favorite!
My favorite local sushi place!!! Go there ALL the time. Love the rolls and the sashimi is great too. Irish Roll is our number one. Reasonable prices and never too overcrowded.

My husband and I go here all the time. The sushi is excellent, the service is prompt, and the sushi chefs are friendly. It is not overpriced, and it is very laid back. I always get sushi- the SS Roll is really good, and it is gluten-free (my husband is allergic to wheat.) This place is rarely crowded, and the sushi is always fresh, so it is our go-to place for a casual night out :)
This was our first time coming here & we will definitely be back! Everything we tried was amazing, especially the screaming orgasm!

Boulder City has only one REAL sushi restaurant and that is Momos.  You can drive to Vegas only to get the same or less quality.  It is small and sometimes everyone in Boulder City decides to come eat at once and it can get busy.  Be patient.  It's worth it.

We liked this place, service was good, selection was great, fish was fresh. Way better than Tokyo boys, thats for sure! I'd still rather go to a good AYCE place but this one wasn't bad and they have some unique stuff on the menu.
Good neighborhood sushi. Small but good. The fish is always fresh and the service good. Love the rolls without rice. My son loves to eat veggie rolls and watch football here.

This place just became one of my top three sushi spots! Great presentation! Great atmosphere and the chefs at the bar are of great conversation and know how to deliver good laughs! The super white fish that I had is by far some of the best tasting kind I've enjoyed. Definitely on a must come back soon list for me.

this is me and my fiancé's favorite sushi restaurant. it makes me sad to see the couple of bad reviews on here. we think the service is great and the food amazing. we always get their specialty roll the momoyama but also try something new every time and its always great. We have a hard time going other sushi places because we like it so much here. Don't pay attention to the bad reviews, test it out yourself. :-)

Stopped in here for lunch yesterday, and since we had recently had sushi, we opted for the bento box. The lunch was fantastic! I had the bento with shrimp tempura and mackeral, and my son had the kalbi and chicken katsu. Everything was really good, however, the kalbi and the tempura were my favorites.

What can I say about MoMo.. They really do have some wonderful Sushi! A bit overpriced in some areas, and no AYCE options, but I have never had a bad roll or bad sashimi here. I used to frequent another Henderson sushi restaurant until their quality went downhill (significantly) and my husband introduced me to MoMo. The Irish roll and Something Wrong are some of my favorites, and if you like crispy (fried) sushi, Tara's Fatty is one for you (read: cream cheese and shrimp). The volcano is also very good if you want more crab and less cream cheese. 

The wait staff can be spotty at times, but never rude. I have only had one issue with a waitress who made my young son cry, but I have not seen her in there in a while. Anyway, if you go on a busy day (Fridays at dinner and Lunch on the weekdays seem to take the cake) then you might get less than stellar wait service if they are understaffed. However, the food more than makes up for the staffing issues in my opinion. I have been going to MoMo for about 2 years now, and highly recommend it over any other sushi restaurant in Henderson.

I'm from Cali and very picky about my sushi it was super yummy and fresh. The waiter was very patient the menu was so large we didn't know what to order. We ended up ordering several items and was more than satisfied this has to be the best sushi we had since relocating to Las Vegas . It's been a long journey looking for good eats especially if your a true foodie from Cali don't think twice you will definitely be satisfied!!!

I will give 5 STARS next time, when the orange slice is not two days old. But thanks for the Gree Tea Ice cream YELP FREE DESSERT. Thank you to Andrew and the staff. They seemed tired and over work for a full house on Friday. But still gave a big smile.

To enjoy this place you need to follow some rules.  Rule one: sit at the sushi bar because the sushi chefs are terrific and the servers are kind of lame.  The menu and choice of rolls is huge and there are some very unique offerings (never saw banana in a roll before) so just dig in because the fish is super fresh.  Rule two: order the sake because it is buy one get one.  If you don't sit at the bar you may miss the sign that announces this amazing deal.  Rule three: make sure not to forget the second sake.  Cheap hot sake is the best!

I will be back!
Excellent. We got three rolls and each was fresh and delicious. Great, friendly service.

This place has great Bento boxes, but the teriyaki chicken had lots of pepper on it (not normal). And then I had to get my own to-go box for my food because we were completely ignored. We had to ask for the check, and when they delivered the check is when they finally asked why I didn't eat my chicken. They were speedy at picking up the check w a credit card, but that was it!

This place never fails to impress me. The staff are so friendly and the food is incredible. No place I have been has sushi that can compare. It is the most comfortable hang out with the best food you could ask for. Love you guys!

Husband and I wanted sushi take out to enjoy during Sunday night football, so this review is for only one visit of take out. The portions are good and fish is very fresh as mentioned before. I liked the roll that had salmon and lemon on top - forgot the name. The baked dynamite I would not order again. Philly roll was good, but that is a basic roll & hard to mess up. Would definitely order from here again, yet the budget won't allow for that all too often because the rolls are a bit pricey here. Standard philly roll was $7 and specialty rolls will run you $13 or more.

The worst - service AND food. Last night (Saturday), we went there for dinner. Sat in the very back of the restaurant and wait staff walked by us ALL the time, but yet we had to ask to get water and ask to please take our order. Once our order was taken, we waited and waited (again wait staff running by us ALL the time). All of the tables around us got their food and began their dinner. We stopped our server and she said oh! I didn't punch in your order. FINALLY we get our meal and my roll had curdled cream cheese in it. It was disgusting. The service here was poor- very poor. I will never go back.
High quality fish, very reasonable prices and FAST, great service! Sit at the bar, the chefs are very entertaining and full of character. We love this place!
Great service! A vast variety of sushi. Too many to count. The sushi was fresh and very flavorful.

Really good sushi, very fresh and great deal on saki
Very friendly staff!

My mom and I had a great dinner here - we had the rainbow roll and the heart attack, and it was SO good. The chefs there are so great! I love crispy rice spicy tuna but they didn't have it on the menu, but they made it for me anyway and it was probably the best I've ever had!

I started to appreciate Momo Sushi more and more, lately.

It is actually a pretty good place, a bit overpriced for the portion size, though.

Portions are very small, though well prepared. They arrive fast, and service is friendly. A bit uneven at times, but the girls excuse that with a genuinely positive attitude and a smile. But there were cases when I was hungry and had to order an appetizer after the main plate just to stop feeling hungry.

Personally I'd prefer a better balance between the quality, size and price of the plates, so Momo won't be a four star in my books - but I am totally ok to return or recommend this place to someone who just wants sushi immediately next to the Chinook mall.

Frequency: First Time, after lunch hours

Order: Sashimi platter (for two), Salmon and a Sweet Egg Nigiri and Sweet (live) shrimp.

Overall: Close proximity to where I live, fresh Sashimi, decent prices and friendly staff!

Some of the best, freshest sushi I've ever had! And in the middle of the desert.

The staff was super friendly. And the prices weren't that bad. Everything was delicious.

The hot tea was brought out in some cool cups too which I thought was cool.

I would Definitely recommend this place to anyone rolling through Boulder City to see Hoover Dam and wants to eat. 

Will be back with the rest of my family all the way from California!
Nice sashimi!  Very fresh and good quality.  It would be perfect if the wasabi in nigiri were even at every piece.

First and the last time I eat at this place! I ordered the Udon shrimp soup, it was so bad, got the veggie noodles ,the broccoli was brown and old the cabbage was so soggy! Waste of money and time , had to throw away the food! So disappointed !!

My favorite place in the area for good sushi and sake!
Check it out in the Henderson area!
Top sushi place.  If they have blue fin tuna, get it!  It's pricey at $10 for two pieces of sashimi, but it's well worth it if you like tuna.  Best I ever had.

What can I say? Amazing, delicious and tasty sushi! Very fresh. I happened to be in Boulder City as my BF had an errand to run. We were starving and I happened to come across yelp and the restaurants in this are. We rolled the dice and are happy we did! It's a quaint little place but it was packed and I can see why. We came right before rush hour, people just kept walking in. Staff was attentive and warm. Great job Momo! If I'm back in this area I will definitely stop by :)
